description:
I'll be pretty honest and say that I really enjoyed TacoBar.  I wouldn't say it's my favorite, but I had their tacos for dinner one night and was very satisfied.  

I'm a sucker for cheese so I had to order their Tacos 'Especial-style' which throws in a crispy Chicharron Cheese shell outside the taco.

Carnitas Especial and Grilled Fish Veracruz Especial Tacos -- http://bit.ly/2vT8p1o
The tacos were a really good size, at least more than 5-6 bites compared to a street taco.  Their carnitas had a nice flavor to them and weren't overcooked and the same can be said about their Fish Veracruz.

Overall, I liked TacoBar.  If I'm in the area with a taco craving, I would consider it an option.  Plus I wouldn't mind going back to try their burritos as well.
author: Rodney H.

description:
This place has gone so downhill...we use to eat here often a few years ago...it was decent. 

Unfortunately, last night stopping in was a mistake.

Unreasonably small portions of mediocre bland food resembling watered down wannabe mexican food.

Overpriced is an understatement. The Asian lady handed a construction worker what appeared to be 8-10 to go burrittos without even giving him a bag...She kept dropping the burritos on the dirty floor and picking them back up again.

Im scarrreeddd to know what goes on in the kitchen

Never ever going back here.
author: T Maria L.

description:
Tacobar is just another overpriced restaurant in Lower Pac Heights. While it does have some good options like the fresh chips, guacamole and some well cooked deep fried fish tacos and burritos, you would can find exponentially better Mexican cuisine south of Market. 

The Baja Pescado burrito and tacos are my go to things to have here, and quite possibly the only thing worth getting here. I think the other tacos on the menu are pretty mediocre. The burrito bowl is awful as well, and I would rather go to Chipotle for one. I do also like the chips, salsa and guac combo here. Their corn on the cob is also decent, except for the fact that it's boiled rather than roasted. The agua fresca here is pretty hit or miss, and I've had times where it was delicious and other times where it tasted quite foul.

All in all, I would only go to Tacobar if I was really craving a burrito while I was in the area, because if you want a good fish taco, you should just go to Woodhouse Fish Co. down the street.
author: Neivin M.

description:
Only word I can think of is ,  nasty. I was ok that the Baja fish taco that took a while because they fry it to order.  Unfortunately, whatever sour sauce they put in the burrito just over powers the entire thing. 
After one bite I wanted to return it but of course I was on my lunch break and super hungry so I ate it . I ate something else just to get the taste out of my mouth. 
I will not be back
author: LaNiesha P.

description: Food was good and service was good also. The place is small so not good for groups of more than four.  Prices were reasonable. Nice trendy place and who doesn't like tacos.  Great variety
author: Jesse G.

description: Underrated taco place, deserves way more than the average stars it has. Tacos are good and fast! What melted my heart was when I saw one of the workers be so sweet and kind to this elderly woman, prob in her 80's. He was patient and was helping her get settled for lunch. 5 stars for the awesome customer service!!!
author: Brooke R.

description: Simple, easy and delicious. They are located off a busy street but still super fast service. Only complaint was the shell was a little soggy and fell apart.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Breakfast burrito review only! 

I continue my search for best breakfast burritos. Shockingly, a lot of places are closed on Sundays and Tacobar is right around the corner so decided to check it out! They have a couple bfast burrito options, but I went with the classic eggs, mexican rice, pinto beans and added potatoes. All bfast burritos come with cheese, gauc and sour cream, but I nixed the sour cream (too much of one texture for me). 

I was actually really pleased with the burrito, really good flavor, constructed well (no extra liquid dripping everywhere) and plenty size to save half for lunch later. I was skeptical of the rice + potatoes but it worked well. Potatoes could have been crispier but not a huge deal and I'm still searching for a burrito with a nice charred tortilla. What I really missed was bacon! They have a chorizo option but I just wasn't fealing it. Also, even without a meat, my burrito still came to $12.00 which I thought was kinda of steep. All in all, I'll be back to mix up some of their bfast burrito options but I recommend stopping by here if in the neighborhood!
author: Aryn C.

description: This place is very expensive. $15 for two tacos with cheese and a drink. Wow. This place even charges for the chips. Why in the hell are you charging for chips. Shouldn't come with with the meal ? The food comes out fast though. I guest that's good.
author: Juanita A.

description:
This place is a little overpriced for the amount of food you receive. The quality is also on the average side. The drinks were smaller than expected. I finished my horchata drink only getting a quarter of the way through my burrito. Yes, I order a burrito at a taco place! I wouldn't recommend the burritos here. Maybe the tacos are on the better side. The service on the other hand is fast and they try to be friendly, but it gets negated when they have pushy salesman attitude. There is no WiFi and seating is a tad limited. The feeling of the place feels more of a grab and go type of feel even though I dine in. The place is clean and situated on Fillmore so lots of people walking up and down the streets to people watch if you're by yourself. 

Overall verdict: average Mexican restaurant so get the tacos if you don't want to be disappointed.
author: Daw M.

description: Horrible.  Low quality.  High prices. Little meat or seafood on the tacos.  2 tacos, chips and a drink. 20.00.  Didn't eat the tacos.   Avoid the place.
author: Larry W.

description: TacoBar is solid. The location on Fillmore is small but convenient if you're in Pac Heights and never seems to be too busy. The service is typically very quick. And the food is tasty! My favorite order is the 'Carne Asada' taco with additional guacamole. The guacamole always tastes fresh and they give you a solid amount of beef per taco. I also really like their Mexican Rice and their Churros are incredible. Only downside of TacoBar is that they're a little overpriced. 4/5 Stars.
author: Katie C.

description: I ate the baja burrito (which as someone else pointed out, is totally overpowered by whatever garbage sauce they put in it) and got violently ill. This place sucks.
author: Jake W.

description: 3.5 stars. Ordered Chicken and beef taco ,taste good and fresh , not the authentic kind
author: Shelley B.

description:
Just fair at best. Super tiny portion of Guacamole was $7. without chips. Chips were $3.50 extra, thats stupid expensive. Counter woman was not welcoming in any way, I should have left then.

Avoid this place.
author: Brad B.

description: I just popped in here to get a quesadilla and I'd have to agree with other Yelpers in that this place a solid solid option for Mexican food. Not the best in the world but not the worst either.
author: Rod M.

description:
I live close by and eat here often.  Its solid / basic Mexican food (tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc).   Food is consistent and fresh but nothing special. The line moves quickly and it doesn't take too long to get food.  Employees are friendly.  

Like most places on Fillmore, it's overpriced for what it is.   It's still one of the more casual and faster places in the area (the Grove is even more overpriced, although Glazed and Roam have them beat for value.  Just depends what you're in the mood for).  

I recommend the esquite / elote when they have corn and the watermelon Agua Fresca.  The weekend brunch items are pretty big, but the tacos are small (I like the grilled shrimp or the carne Asada). I also like the tortilla soup - it's big and has a lot of tortilla strips in it, so it's filling.
author: Holly P.

description:
I used to live 2 blocks from La Taqueria (and am still loyal to their carne asada), so I feel like a bit of a sell-out giving props to Taco Bar. But context is everything... 

1) Yes it's expensive for a taqueria (cost of chips and guacamole is absurd) based on the standard set by Mission taquerias
2) Their Baja Pescado taco is legit good. Not skimpy at all, always freshly fried, great balance of cabbage slaw, and tasty sauces
3) Their short rib taco with horseradish (an occasional special menu item) is a revelation 
4) Their salsas are great and they don't adulterate their pricy guacamole with tomatoes 
5) They have amazing churros

Service is fine, not great. But that's true of most places in SF. :-/
author: Seema S.

description:
This place is garbage.

Can't wait until they get it that nobody wants bad, overpriced white people Mexican food, and leave. Someone should open a kosher deli or something to match the temple up the street, cuz this is a disgrace to my tastebuds.

Seriously, if you don't live in this neighborhood, no reason to stop here. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but the next place with real tacos, if that's what you crave, is south of Market.

Only reason it gets two stars is because I haven't gotten sick from eating their food yet.
author: JWest M.

description:
Needs better customer service ! 
Gives you less food ... 
not pleased for everything I ordered
author: Rate I.

description: Delicious! I had the vegetarian bowl and it was so fresh and delicious. The chips were warm and obviously fresh. My dad had the tortilla soup and it was AMAZING! The watermelon aqua fesca was his favorite. I would definitely go back again. Very close to the Presidio for a nice afternoon walk.
author: Olivia R.

description: This is a busy space around lunch- you order at the counter and chips are extra *I wish there was a sm side chips/ I can never justify getting a huge basket). My FAV is the fish burritto - a local fried (or grilled) rock cod - and avocado for extra lushness for those of us that can't do dairy sauces. Aqua Frescas tacos and fresh eats with SF $$. Colorful dining room and super friendly staff.
author: Coco J.

description: TacoBar is the place to go for a quick bite to eat while you're in the area. Their tacos are served on small tortillas and I think the portion was good for the price paid. I ordered one Baja fish taco which was tasty and had a good balance of toppings, but the fish was a little soggy and not as crisp as it should be. We also got the corn on the cob that had sour cream, some grated cheese and chili powder on it. I was hoping to have something more to it like mayonnaise or cilantro, but it tasted just fine without these! Overall, service was pretty quick and the staff was nice. I'd recommend for a quick bite to eat if you're passing through.
author: Ly N.

description: I must say this place was just ok. Although I did enjoy the Baja fish taco I ordered, it was not enough to satisfy my taco cravings considering this is called a "TacoBar". They serve them on street sized tortillas. And if you know what size they are, they are for children. $4.50 each. Lol Serving portions are very small. Chips and Salsa cost $3.95. Any authentic Mexican restaurant would serve them for free. Agua frescas cost $4.50 in a small cup. One size only. Cashier spilled it and didn't offer to refill. Had our food served AFTER another group of ladies ordered their food who were standing behind 2 other people behind us. I felt Unwelcome in this establishment since our order was pretty simple: 2 tacos, chips and salsa, one drink and a churro compared to the others who ordered taco bowl salads and a few tacos on the side with drinks in glasses and served before us. To top it off, it look like the owner who served them and checked in on them but said nothing else to the rest of the patrons. Oh we sat next to these ladies as well. Plus, we never did get that churro that cost $2.75 since the cashier forgot to ring it up. You could say we got lucky! Lol other than that, this place is a joke. Unfortunately, I will not be returning or recommending this place.
author: Martine D.

description: There's not much to this place - just overpriced average tasting food. If you're in the neighborhood and you need your tacos NOW, then go for it. Otherwise you're not missing much.
author: Debbie M.

description:
We were around the area and wanted a quick meal before heading to an event. No one could decide what they wanted and I saw "taco" on the sign and sold my friends on it. I actually didn't get the tacos though. Maybe I should have? I got a steak quesadilla instead. It was alright. I wish there was more cheese, the steak was okay, and the salsa was just alright. The portion was decent and I pretty much ate all of it. 

Overall, it was alright.
author: Sophia Y.

description: I stopped here to grab a quick bite for lunch but it turned out to take a bit longer than I thought it would. I ordered a chicken taco and got soggy pretty quickly because of the juice. I also had an amazing pomegranate margarita that I'd recommend off of their drink menu. I wouldn't stop by if you're in a hurry but the margarita I had evened out the visit.
author: Christopher W.

description: TacoBar. 17.50 (with tip) for huevos mexicana. A watery, gooey surprise I got on a 15min lunch break. No time to go back which I plan never to do. I leave it to you to draw a conclusion!
author: Todd R.

description:
Overpriced for less-than average Mexican food. 
If you must try this place, I recommend their fish & shrimp tacos.
Food is generally bland here.

If you live around the area and want Mexican food, then check out El Burrito Express 2 (https://www.yelp.com/review_share/CS6NaMbTlzD-9yc3DBBrKw/review/Lhg7L_kQGpa9GQ96zYJLiw)
author: Jenn H.

description: You will get an overpriced NOTHING. Nachios were fried not baked, they had 90% of bean paste and nothing else, some cheese yes, and on top they put something like a mayo they squeezed out of a plastic bottle that they said was cream. The nachios on the menu however contained a whole different list of ingredients, including pico de gialo, of which my plate contained 0. Also rude staff. There was more staff than the guests, and now I know why. The server woman was sweeping the floor in the middle of my eating there and I asked for a glass of water. She pointed where to get it instead of bringing it! avoid this place by all costs. What a terrible waste of a perfect location
author: B B.

description:
Incredibly overpriced for the quality, poor diner experience, shady billing practices. Skip.

Large burritos that start at 9.99 for regular. With drink (horchata) price somehow ads up to $15. 

Same thing when I had two tacos. 

They also ROUTINELY fail to give you an itemized copy of your receipt; if you pay with a card they only hand you the merchant copy. Sneaky.
author: Anthony N.

description: Medi-ocre at best. Shrimp taco was nothing write home about with the three small shrimp. Would've been better if they cut it up to make it look like there's more. The fried fish taco is much better, so it's good but like an average good not outstanding. For $4.50 a taco it almost feels like they're being a little stingy. I wouldn't  run back here unless my options were non existent. I do like they bring the order to you, though
author: Brandi W.

description: Love the mango salsa and shrimps. Keep in mind you probably need more than 2 tacos to get full here
author: Alex L.

description:
They took the wrong order and didn't offer to change it for me. The food I got was terrible. Just laughable. I've been multiple times, awful every time. Also overpriced.

Not enough meat, taco salad shell sucks ass, weak agua fresca, dry carnitas, undercooked black beans, and to top it all off, they have the gall to call it Mexican food...
author: N M.

description:
TacoDarkBar

TacoBar is good, but it's my opinion that some of these places struggle to find their identity. Take the decor, there is a vibe trying to peek out... liquid filled lamp by the window,  driftwood art piece with some type of mystery plant living on it, pink and yellow pastel chairs...retro chic meets Haight yard sale...sorta works...

Food Prep:
Let's start with the dark corner where food is prepared...um, it's pretty dark...for precaution's sake I'm facing the door in case the cook's grease rags light up.  The kitchen has a "lived in" look and shouts "we makin' burritos up in he'ya, up in he'ya!"

Hospitality:
The head lady brusquely took my order, I've had more joy paying for bus fare.  The guacamole was left off the order but provided once we let them know.  A patron left without chips when told they were not included with guacamole.

Fare:
The fare was good, actually.  Mexi typically is, and we were hungry to boot; add that to the equation and TacoBar becomes TacoPrimo! The Steak Taco  was tasty, so were the quesadilla and fish taco, the guac was good too but dam lady, I could crack a tooth on those chips!

Prices:
A little higher than you would expect (so is everything these days), but not a difference maker.



.
author: Jason J.

description: There are much better options for tacos elsewhere. Came here for lunch and ordered a grilled fish taco and a fried fish taco. Both were terrible. Not only are the prices inflated for a taco that has NO sour cream, NO beans, NO salsa and No nothing except for dry Cole slaw, they were both extremely bland. Completely flavorless and without seasoning. I gave an extra star for the fresh salsa/guacamole and the pomegranate margarita was pretty good.
author: Andreea M.

description: Food is semi ok if you like bland. Drinks are horrible. Ordered a pitcher of margarita and it was too cheap alcohol with a strange after taste. Add to that the bad customer service, a recipe to never return.
author: Rosy C.

description:
Wow... Just wow. For a $13 burrito, you'd think it'd be tastier than mediocre but nope, not here at least. I ordered a shrimp burrito w/ guacamole, cream, and cheese (which costs an extra $0.50-$1 for each, by the way) and there were like 4 small pieces of shrimp inside! It was mostly filled with cabbage slaw which was really disappointing. This was the most bland tasting shrimp burrito I've ever had and I didn't know that was even possible. The other reviewers aren't lying; this place is subpar, at best. Only positive thing about this place is the cleanliness and decor. Tacobar is expensive and very stingy with their portions-- most definitely wouldn't recommend to anyone looking for tasty and reasonably priced food.

P.S. they don't give a break down of your order/charges in the receipt and are unclear about the add-on prices. Shady, shady, shady...
author: Jenny L.

description:
Now actually, $8.50 for a burrito are not that bad. What you get in return are high quality ingredients that make your fast (Mexican) food a delightful surprise.

What converted me into a TacoBar fan last night was their VERACRUZ PESCADO - or steamed fish burrito. Fantastic tortilla, the ingredients great in taste, and all nicely presented and wrapped up. 

Chips and guac - also a delight. 

Looks like I'm a fan now.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Food is good, convenient and relatively inexpensive for Fillmore. I LOOVE the watermelon agua Fresca so much - I often stop by just to grab one of them on my way home. The avocado Cesar is pretty good and the nachos are great.

What I love most about this place is that the staff is so incredibly nice. Super helpful and always with a smile. I go back again and again primarily because everyone is so pleasant!
author: Sara M.

description: Nothing amazing, but it's a decent, fairly unpretentious (for the neighborhood) taco spot in a part of the city that doesn't have a ton of Mexican! Obviously you could get something better for a lower price in another location, but if you're on Fillmore and you need tacos, this is a solid bet.
author: Piper A.

description: This place is underrated imo. The Baja pescado (tempura beer batter) is delicious with the slaw and salsa that it comes with. Also had a pomegranate margarita which was very good. A burrito for 10 and a margarita for 7 is a great deal in this area. Definitely coming back
author: Roman K.

description:
I've definitely had better Mexican food before but this satisfied my craving. The service is really nice here and the place is clean with plenty of seating.

I got the Baja Pescado burrito ($9). The beer battered mahi mahi was tasty except there was a TON of cabbage slaw in mine and 1/3 of my bites were slaw only. I'd probably get the taco version next time instead. My boyfriend got the carne asada nachos ($10) which I thought was way better. It was full of cheese, beans, meat, salsa, and guacamole. The serving size for both of our orders was very filling.
author: Linda X.

description: Decent lunch spot with some fair priced Tacos, Burros and more. I liked their Camaron Burrito, nice touch with the spicy shrimp and fruity mango. We also enjoyed some daytime margaritas, which were good. Nothing crazy exciting, but nice to buzz up the afternoon. They have some outside seating, which was great on this really sunny day. We definitely brought in some more customers by just sitting there, sipping on our drinks. I'd be back for a simple lunch or a quick bite on the go.
author: Katja S.

description: Needed to get some food and we were in the neighborhood. Had the shrimp and fish tacos and they weren't that great. Flavors were off but I couldn't put my finger on what the problem was. It's also a tell tale sign when you ask for a food recommendation and there isn't a strong answer back. Tacos or burritos? And after a few seconds the answer was "well, burritos give you more food for the price"....
author: Laura D.

description:
Having to be at CPMC for visitations for a week, I walked down to Fillmore get dinner "to go" on during this time.  Walked by and checked out the menu and decided to get a burrito at TacoBar at the corner of California and Fillmore. 

Placed my order for the carne asada burrito, which consisted of pinto beans, Mexicano rice and Pico de Gallo.  No side of chips or salsa came with the order. As for the burrito, it had good flavor but a couple bites into it, I didn't taste the beef yet. This was a carne asada burrito that was short on the beef. 

Restaurant had a nice décor and service was friendly, but given the price, the burrito was just ok relative to ones I've had in the City.
author: Al L.

description:
Pretty good but over-priced. 

Cost is around $15 per person, for small portions. About twice the price of Gordo's for the same quality food. 

The cashier asked if we wanted chips. I asked if they cost extra, and he said no -- no charge. My kid ran off with the chips, and started munching away. When I was presented with a higher than expected bill, I asked why. He said that was the total. I tried again, asking to see the itemized bill. He said he couldn't show it until I paid. I said, sorry, I need to see the itemized bill first. We went back and forth until he reluctantly showed me the bill. "No charge"
was actually $6.75!

Then one of us got a (very skinny) burrito for around $12 -- ironically called a "burro" as if to imply it's a huge burrito. These guys are definitely bumping up against false advertising laws. At $12, they are $2-3 above what even burrito places downtown -- with steep rents -- charge. 

Churros are $2.50 each, again kind of pricey. 

It's clear now why they don't list prices for their items listed on the wall. Their business model is overcharging their customers.
author: Al S.

description:
I am sorry to say this place has really gone downhill.  It used to be really good, one of the best tortilla soups in the city that saved me when I was sick--no more. None of the distinctive spices, vegetables, and rich broth of a while back.    The tacos are small, limp,  and tasteless--all the cooking seems halfhearted and very little sabor or seasoning.

I wish they'd pull themselves together--it could be good.  Why suck if you can help it?  And you can help it if you want to. Get it together tacobar!

Uncomfortable to sit in--door wide open when it's 50 degrees outside.  What's up with that?
author: harmonia b.

description: Extremely overpriced and below average food. Popped in here as I just moved to the area and was very disappointed for my first dinner in pac heights! It's a fast food place with restaurant prices. Skip it.
author: Natalie C.

description:
I came here for a late lunch. It was moderately crowded with a lot of people who seemed to be ordering to go. Nice friendly corner spot with a good amount of seating, both regular tables, counter top tables, and two small tables out front.

I got a fish taco and a carnitas taco which were both pretty good. I'm more of a simple traditional taco with meat onion and cilantro but these were pretty well made with extras like beans salsa and guac. The fish was really good and tender with lots of flavor. Soft and perfectly cooked. The carnitas was decent but slightly dry for my taste. 

The only downside for my meal was 1.  Chips were not free (cmon, man, free chips is a staple at Mexican joints) and 2. My sister got a burrito and when asked whether she wanted sour cream, guac and cheese, she replied with no sour cream but she received a burrito with no guac or cheese but only sour cream.

Other than those two gripes, solid place to come for upper scale style Mexican food.
author: Dylan L.

description:
Wow, what a great spot for a quick bite! 

My GF and I stopped in post Core40 starving due to the crazy line at Jane. We were a little hesitant since the place was a empty on a Saturday during lunch but I'm glad we came in! 

We ordered veggie, grilled fish and pork tacos and they were gone in about five minutes. Huge amount of fresh veggies on each of them and loads of flavor. Perfect tacos!!! 

All the women that work there were very friendly and provided great service. 

We sat in the window and people watched and it was a lovely little break before shopping all the great stores on Filmore.
author: Alison C.

description: Took a chance to try this place out. Ordered two chicken tacos. OMG so good, meat was seasoned and moist, tortillas were fresh along with all the salsas they have to choose from. They also gave free chips and salsa. All of the choices appeared fresh! Place is clean staff friendly and ready to take your order. Quick and easy I will definitely be back.
author: Demi D.

description: The interior is colorful, casual, and clean- has a great taqueria type vibe. I LOVED the horchata and the burrito (burro vegetariano)  was very solid--- would go back.
author: J K.

description:
Just an ok taco joint in the lower pac heights area. The street it's on is filled with a ton of restaurants some of which, in my opinion, are way better than this place! 

I don't have a lot of complaints about this place, I just didn't think it was that great either! One thing that I loved was that they had two different corn appetizers: elote and esquite! I tried the esquite which is corn in a bowl with cream and cheese. It was a little watery, but overall, very yummy! I also tried the veggie tacos and a veggie burrito. The outer cheese shell that comes with the veggie tacos was interesting but not really my cup of tea. The veggies in the tacos were mainly just carrots and they didn't have a lot of flavor in my opinion. I loved the guac that it came with and they don't skimp on how much guac they give you (ahem chipotle). The burrito was also just alright; nothing super special, it was just your regular run-of-the-mill veggie burrito. 

The decor is interesting and the service is fast, but there are definitely better Mexican restaurants in SF!
author: Malika R.

description:
TL;DR: best spot for burritos in the Pac Heights area. Try their breakfast burrito with carne asada, cheese, and guacamole for a delicious morning treat!

 I'm a serious burrito snob. Everything gets compared to what I grew up with in San Diego, Rosarito, and Ensenada, and in San Francisco, very few places have been good enough.

Enter Tacobar; it's become my go-to for burritos any day of the week! The carne asada is melt-in-your-mouth tender, the guacamole is on point and not too onion-y, their habañero salsa has great flavor, and the horchata is rich with flavors of rice and cinnamon. Even their Baja-style fish tacos and burritos have an authentic Tijuana flair! 

But the crown jewel of their menu isn't any particular burrito, but simply the tortilla they wrap them in. It's soft, flavorful, and doesn't crack and break when you pick up the burritos. It's even got that stick-to-your-teeth consistency that makes it even more delicious!

The decor is reminiscent of small Baja California taco shops, brightly colored but simple, and while outdoor seating is limited, it's nice to snag a spot and people watch as you devour whatever deliciousness you ordered. Their order cards are Spanish vocabulary words, and there's a box of cards floating around the restaurant occasionally which turns waiting for your food into a fun game, trying to guess what a "sacapuntas" is.

All said, this place is worth every penny. Maybe one day I'll find a place in SF I like better, but until then, Tacobar is my burrito joint of choice! 

¡Bien hecho, muchachos!
author: Dylan H.

description:
Boyfriend and I were wandering around looking for something small to eat and came upon tacobar. It looked pretty good with a full menu so we decided to give it a try. 

Best random find ever. 

The carne asada taco was super good. Not only do they have the regular soft shell they have a hard, sweeter shell outside that makes the taco crunchy but soft at the same time. The guac was super tasty and the steak was meaty and not fatty. The salsa had a nice kick to it. I didn't try the torta but boyfriend said it was really good.

The churros were really yummy with the right amount of crunch but also a soft cream filling. Wholly satisfying. 

The staff were friendly and we were greeted with smiles and were served quickly. 

I don't know if it's because I didn't have any expectations that I am so surprised by the quality of this place but I do know I'll definitely be back.
author: Kelly Y.

description: Tried the fish tacos... Best one is the battered; Nice balance of flavors. The grilled one was smokey but bland.
author: H T.

description:
Pains me to write this review because I genuinely believe the employees are decent people, but this is about principle and if you're going to be in as affluent of a neighborhood as pacific heights, you gotta measure up. 

The food is tasty but incredibly overpriced. Most importantly, I came tonight with my boyfriend & our pomegranate margaritas had BUGS IN THEM---I'm not kidding, little black, striped, winged dead insects in our margaritas. I couldn't believe it- in fact we checked them up close to be sure before mentioning to our server. There were about four or five in mine- maybe about three in my boyfriends cup. They were floating dead toward the surface of our drinks; I pulled one out to inspect it. Yup. Definitely bugs. 

What turned me off more than the bug-aritas was our servers response to them- instead of apologizing and actually looking closely at what we showed her, she casually refutes: "it's just pepper from the margaritas, no , not bugs, we'll bring new ones out." No apologies , no looking at what I was trying to show her; just telling me I was wrong and glossing over my concern. I do admit the drinks were good once she brought them back, but I was entirely turned off and so was my appetite.
author: Pjay E.

description: Food is ok. When you get hungry yes everything is good.  The service needs to be improved.
author: PerK N.

description:
Cheap and cheerful neighborhood taco bar with plenty vegetarian options. Liked the bright red/blue/yellow decor, but would have liked to have prices written on menu board, kinda weird to order blind.

I tried the tacos, and they were very generous with the guac, bonus for people who love the green stuff. The taco was inside a crispy cheesy shell which was delicious, but the vegetable selection was mostly carrots, a little disappointing. Two tacos worked out at $10 with tip, and they have margarita options that I'll try next time. Quick and easy local joint.
author: Zara S.

description:
Tacobar is small surfer taco spot located in a nice little area in SF. It's a good place to grab a quick bite, but don't expect anything too authentic. During my visit, I had a chance to try their baja shrimp taco.

Baja shrimp taco (3/5)
Their baja shrimp tacos are composed of tempura fried shrimp, mango & jicama salsa, Cole slaw, and guac and cheese shell as requested. The shrimp wasn't very crispy. The batter was extremely thick and fell off the shrimp even before I bit into it. However the best part of the taco was the mango and jicama salsa. Its a perfect combo and tastes delicious. The cheese shell also adds a nice additional flavorful crunch, so I highly recommend you add that on. 

Overall, a good place to grab a quick bite, but their food falls a bit short for me.
author: Joanne Y.

description: Ordered 3 Baja Shrimp Tacos and a Watermelon drink. I almost gasped when they told me it would be $24 but I can't complain as they do have their prices on their menu. I was a little bummed but I truly loved my tacos and drink. My meal was very delicious. Although pricey, I would highly recommend my friends give it a try. Staff was very nice as well.
author: Jay T.

description:
I've eaten here twice now. I work in the area and the options for a 30 minute lunch are slim. The first time, they charged me ~$8 for a bean and rice burrito. It was flavorless. Big deal, another "Mexican" place in a rich white area that has no idea what they're doing. 

Today, I was craving a breakfast burrito and my boyfriend brought me one from here. It was maybe 1 egg scrambled with chorizo on one side and then those flavorless rice and beans on the other side. Unimpressive, and I could barely tell I was eating chorizo. 

Then, halfway through, I bit down on something hard and metal. It looks like it was peeled away from iron wool. It was in my burrito, my flavorless, flavorless burrito.

I will never waste money or time here again, and for anyone looking to avoid being charged $8+ for tasteless dirt, I urge you to never even try it.


EDIT: Tacobar staff has since reached out to me to offer a refund and their deepest apologies. I stand by my review 100%, but it is always worth mentioning that they care deeply about their customers.
author: Mary T.

description: Taco Bar is a quick reliable dinner stop for my family. We live nearby and it's convenient when shopping/running errands on Fillmore. It is small, cozy and colorful. The folks that work there are nice and friendly and will customize your order as needed. My sons love the fish tacos; my husband gets the taco salad and I like the chicken burrito with green sauce. The chips, guacamole and salsa are good and the food is fresh. Worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Laurine G.

description:
I was very hungry and I noticed this corner of Fillmore and California Street , seem cozy and nice.
I ask the guy behind the counter and told him give me the best of your burrito which he suggested fish burrito I ordered it
$12 for burrito $3.50 for bottle of Coke $4.50 for  tortilla chips and salsa
I always even if the food is not good I never complain but this time it was so bad sloppy watery and no taste at all I couldn't believe I'm paying almost $25 for this garbage please don't ever go you'll be sorry it's not personal it's not about money most of it about the quality
author: Farid A.

description: Carne Asada quesadilla excellent. Great salsa and guacamole. Friendly courteous staff. Have been waiting to return and do some people watching!
author: Paul D.

description:
This place is very solid and consistent. The kids burrito is awesome and myself and toddlers inhale them on the daily.

During the blackout on last Friday they were packed.... i called and the manager took my order over the phone and let me wait until after my meal to pay. They were so accommodating to me and my family... even though they were slammed the food and service was great.
author: A D.

description: The worst food I've had in the 7 years I've lived in SF! If everything wasn't closed for Easter would never have walked in.  Disgusting food a complete waste of money and terrible attitude from the staff.  Do NOT walk in!
author: Niveen S.

description: I went here for lunch and ordered a carnitas burrito with a pineapple aqua fresca. My aqua fresca tasted watered down and wierd, worst then powder ones I can get at the super market. My burrito was small for the price and my carnitas tastes bland, real bland. And the salsa did not help at all, was watered down and not spicy. Overall very bad experience, never again. Stay away.
author: Dang D.

description: Never had an issue with this place, I get the same thing every time. It's always good. I see people complain about prices or some other stuff - go to the mission then. Otherwise, great Michelada, great chicken nachos, no it's not cheap - what is in this city? McDonalds?
author: Shaun P.

description: I just had the most delicious shrimp taco loaded up with jicama mango salad. It was so good I ordered two more.  The owner Antonia is very nice and brought me a short rib taco to try!
author: Hilary M.

description: This is my least favorite place for Mexican in the city. Prices are way out of whack for what you get. Quality is so-so
author: Natalie S.

description:
I went here for the first time a few nights ago with two of my friends.

Started off with a pomegranate margarita (let's be honest you have to get a marg when you're going for Mexican...am i right?!) Anyways, we also ordered chips and guac to start off. The only "complaint" I have is that the food came out probably 5 minutes after we sat down. Not saying that it's bad when food comes out to the table quickly but when I go out for dinner with friends, we're taking our time, ordering apps and drinks and we don't want to feel rushed, which we did a little bit. If they had held off on the food for about 10 minutes longer that would have been nice. That being said........

Definitely one of the most amazing carne asada super burritos i've ever had in SF so far. For those of you who do not know what a super burrito entails...it is everything amazing you could ever imagine: rice, beans, guac, sour cream, cheese, salsa, and carne asada (other meat options available). The tortilla was 100% the best i've ever had. It was like silk in my mouth. cannot even begin to explain its amazingness. you'll have to try it yourselves.

Will definitely be back here in the near future!
author: Ilana B.

description:
I arrived with expectations of a delicious burrito, but was disappointed. 

When arriving, the staff wasn't inviting, I had to initiate a salutation after standing at the counter for 2 minutes, took a look at the menu and decided to go with the carnitas burro (their version of a burrito). For $13.50, which included guac, sour cream and cheese, I had high expectations for this burro that also came with small sides of red & green salsas. Also, just for level setting expectations, chips are extra, so I declined to try them on this visit.

The Verdict: The burrito was disappointing. The carnitas was okay, but the burrito wasn't hot, the guac was no where to be found and was over-stuffed with rice. The only redeeming factor was the salsa's, which were delicious. 

It's too bad as I live close-by, but would recommend walking down the hill to Tacko or Toma any day of the week for a cheaper and more delicious burrito with a side of friendlier service.
author: Peter D.

description:
My favorite taco place in the city. Get the fish and prawn tacos - these are the best ones (baja and camaron)

Oh the home made watermelon drink is very nice and very sweet. 

The place has a nice vibe (teaching you a bit of Spanish), and is across from Smitten ice cream if you're looking for a cool dessert.
author: Eido G.

description: Great food! I lived in San Diego for years, and tacobar is almost as good. Way better than anywhere is the Mission. Will definitely come back.
author: Ellie L.

description: Decent Mexican restaurant in the Pacific District of SF. Came here once for a quick bite for lunch. I ordered their carne asada quesadilla, which I thought was okay. The rectangular shape of the quesadilla was pretty unique. Their steak was tender but the quality of the meat was pretty average. The tortilla wrap was very crisp, which was great. The cheese was very heavy and oily.
author: Alvin W.

description: Came here for a quick lunch, it was pretty crowded when we got in but we're able to order quickly and also get our food quickly. The food was pretty good, a little expensive. The only complain I have was when I was asked if I wanted guacamole, cheese and sour cream, I said no sour cream but the only thing she put in was sour cream -___- lol
author: Jay C.

description:
TacoBar was the perfect finishing touch to my San Francisco experience. I ordered a jicama salad and a pomegranate margarita. The salad was really creatively made, with grapefruit, jicama and avocados, and had the right balance of sweet and tang. The margarita was pretty, pink and oh-so-refreshing. What more does a girl want on a hot summer afternoon? 

Friendly service, nice seating area, kid-friendly too. Highly recommended!
author: Swati P.

description: A great family-run type joint with a couple spots to sit outside, but is a place made more for a quick bite. Great staple Mexican selections.
author: Leo M.

description:
It's weird going to a Mexican restaurant in SF where you pay $10 for a regular veggie burrito. But everything on this part of Fillmore is a little over-priced so I'm not entirely surprised. Also there was spicy salsa in the burrito already. If you don't like spicy, I guess you have specify mild salsa. I usually do like spicy, but I was actually hoping for bland today due to my stomach not doing so well, so that was a disappointment. The veggie burrito is supposed to come with guacamole, but there was only guac at the bottom 1/5th of the thing. The veggie burrito comes with grilled veggies, including crunchy under-cooked potatoes. Great. Now my stomach really won't be happy. :( 

I have gotten fish tacos here too before, also somewhat over-priced for the city. But in the most recent experience at taco bar, there was one positive: the burrito came much faster than the tacos and provided more nutrients / $. 

I want this place to stay on Fillmore because it's the only mexican place that I've seen in the vicinity, but if you could fix a couple things: 1) tell your customers that the burrito comes with spicy salsa or ask how spicy they want it; 2) cook the potatoes all the way if you add them, otherwise skip em; 3) spread the guac over the whole burrito.
author: Alex S.

description: Worst micheladas ever: they tasted like a watered beer with a hint of Clamato juice, the food was ok, hence the one star. Way better Mexican restaurants on mission. By the way we (wife and I) are from Guatemala where we do know how a good michelada is supposed to taste.
author: Luis P.

description: Eat here out of convenience, usually always get the fish tacos, they are really good. Today I went with the carne asada burrito. One bite everyone knows the rules rating was a 7.1. Respectable size, taste was decent, strong wrap job. They could have really blown this rating up if they pressed the burrito before I got it in a grill press. Would have really helped it. Anyways, will probably come back and just get fish tacos, don't mess with a good thing!
author: Adam H.

description:
Stopped in here yesterday because there was no line and needed something quick to eat.  
First thing I notice is no prices listed anywhere, couldn't even find a menu with the prices.  I thought maybe the little color-coding meant cheap/normal/expensive but no, it was different dietary options.  So anyway I knew it was going to be overpriced. 

I just wanted something small, like a "baby" bean & cheese...but for some reason they had every combination (bean & rice, rice & cheese, beans, rice & cheese) but bean & cheese.  Now that I'm looking at the menu online I see something called "cheese beans burrito"  but I didn't see that at the time so I went for the bean, rice & cheese.  

So I go to the front counter and ask if it's okay to order off the kids menu and the cashier shrugs as if it'll be okay this time but he might be breaking the rules.  So I order the bean, rice, & cheese kids burrito and it comes to $7.51 after tax.  I only give a $.49 tip cause I'm having a hard time thinking I'm gonna spend more than $8.00 on a plain kids burrito.  

Anyway, they bring out the burrito really fast and it was definitely a good size and I actually enjoyed it a lot, of course I had to put plenty of the red & green salsas on top but I could taste the quality of the ingredients.  I'd put this burrito more in the $4.50-$6.00 range but I was in a hurry and the staff were actually quite friendly.  

I definitely think to try this place if I'm in the neighborhood, but I'll navigate the menu a bit closer and not expect local taqueria prices (which have lately almost caught up in price to places like this)
author: Travis M.

description: One of the best burritos I've ever had in my humble opinion. I'm shocked that Taco Bar doesn't have better reviews honestly. The food is great, service is quick and top notch, it's in a perfect location in lower pac heights amidst some of the best restaurants in the city and it's always packed with people. My roommate and I get a burrito from here almost every Sunday night- we are slightly obsessed. The burritos never disappoint and are ready within minutes. Also a fan of their tacos! If you want a quick authentic Mexican meal you will not be disappointed.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Decent casual fast food on filmore. Nothing too great but it's nice to have a spot for some quick take out. The meat in the tacos was a little dry but I liked the salsa and guac

Likes: 
Mango salsa
Pulled pork taco special 
Chips topped w cotija cheese
author: Daniela J.

description: Live in the neighborhood and decided to swing by for a quick bite. Ordered the Baja fish burrito and was incredibly underwhelmed for $14. I had a few bites and had to throw it out. Take your money and head down to Divisadero for better Mexican food if you are in the area.
author: Ryan G.

description: Carnitas taco salad on whole wheat baked tortilla - YUM! This place is awesome! Definitely need to come back for chilaquiles and breakfast burritos!
author: Tish M.

description: Despite the not so great rating, tried it over the weekend. Just got the fish tacos that were excellent. Might be back for the huevos rancheros at some point.
author: John C.

description:
Good location, mixed on the food. Not sure if I'll be back.

Good stuff:

Tortilla soup
Chips with Cojita Cheese
Nachos
Kids bean and cheese burrito

Bad stuff:

Quesadilla - soggy and shaped like a burrito
Ice Tea - weird flavors, not pleasant, just do plain!
author: M K.

description: Tacobar is amazing. Cheesy tortilla chips, amazing quesadillas especiales. One of my favorite regular spots for lunch in Pacific Heights.
author: H. S.

description: I had the tortilla soup and rice and beans. Both were over salted and the worst tortilla soup and rice and beans I ever had.
author: Robbie R.

description: Excellent pollo taco ! I could've eaten two more generous with pollo.. Tea was good a little under sweeten for my taste.
author: G F.

description:
Excellent customer service, very tasty salsas... Love their menu super fresh and healthy! Not your super greasy mission taqueria; don't get me wrong those are great at 2am. Love that they only use free range chicken and line caught fish. 
Place is very clean and they serve food quickly.
I defitnitely recommend it !
Order the avocado Cesar salad with beef and grilled fish...
author: Alejandro S.

description: This taco bar was pretty good.  I tried both grilled fish and carnitas tacos.  They were both delish, but kinda small for ~$5 each.  The grilled fish came with a red sauce that was very similar to how I've actually had it served in Mexico and the green salsa they served at the table was a good addition to spice it up just a little.  The chips, salsa and guac just weren't anything to write home about though.  The chips are the really hard, heavy variety and I really prefer light, thin and crisp.  This would clearly be a 4 star spot, but the price and lack of good chips drops it down a notch.
author: Cameo W.

description: They must be struggling if they charge for chips. Don't know any Mexican rest that charges for a handful of chips. Good burrito other than that.
author: Alisa P.

description: So yum!!! Loved the Baja and carnitas...full of flavor, washed it all down with super refreshing watermelon fresca!!
author: Raquel S.

description:
Came here tonight and was pretty satisfied. 

Food: I wasn't super hungry, so I just had 2 carne asada tacos. The meat was tender and the beans and salsa on top were delicious. Only problem was my tortillas were soggy and falling apart, which means I had to eat my tacos with a fork.

The mango agua fresca was delicious. And hit the spot. chips and salsa are extra $, weird but not surprising cause you can get away with that in Pac Heights. We didn't get any.

Service: It's a pretty casual and service goes along with that. But everyone's friendly and our food came out super fast. 

Ambience: Small, but decent layout. It's tight in there though. I can't imagine a busy night in there. Holy crap! Some of the tables hadn't been cleared when we walked in but that could just be because they were busy.

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying some of their burritos soon! Overall a good experience.
author: Alana K.

description: I ordered a chicken burrito w/sour cream & guac/super.  $15.  Had like no guac barely, like maybe 1/2 tsp mixed in the sour cream.  Over all ok the chicken had a smokey grill taste, but had the Applebee's preserved type taste.  Also they don't have any prices up on the wall menu board.  Just kinda dumb & annoying.  & no chips.  screw them didn't even ask after I paid
author: Jane D.

description: This place is bomb. I love tacos and I stopped in one day for lunch! They have minimal seating but I managed to grab a spot outside to enjoy the (rare) sunny day in SF in July. I highly recommend this place if you're in the areas! Carnitas was my favorite.
author: Teresa C.

description:
As some of you may've already figured out from my other reviews, I love me some good tacos. I ended up at TacoBar after trying my attempt to get a bowl of ramen at the first annual ramen fest.

I was very excited to try TacoBar. One topping that caught my attention was the duck confi and it did not disappoint. Unfortunately, every other topping did. My favorite is carnitas and their's was surprisingly bland. So was their fish taco. It was not crispy at all.

In summary, TacoBar didn't meet my expectations. Maybe they were overwhelmed by the overflow from the ramen fest so I will give them another chance.
author: Albert L.

description: This review is long overdue- my office team and I have been loyal customers here for years. We have always received outstanding service and great food. I have the upmost respect for this company. A few months back my boss left her wallet on the counter along with some cash for a tip. Not only did they hold her wallet for her, they made sure it was given to the right person, they even put the cash left aside it back into the wallet. This really says something about the companies values and I will continue to be a loyal customer and highly recommend
author: Shelby G.

description:
Ordered a Carne Asada Burrito

Pros: fresh ingredients, carne asada was juicy large chunks of flavorful beef. Food was made very quick. Burrito was wrapped nice and tight didn't fall apart at all.  

Cons: Menu on walls have no prices, felt like this was a trick to get people in. To add guac only in my burrito was $1.50!! Absurd. Total cost was almost $12 with no chips no drink. They offered chips and when I asked if there was an additional charge they said yes. Majority of taquerias in SF give you chips and salsa free. 

Overall I found the place unnecessarily overpriced. Don't understand why anyone would eat here when El Burrito Express is only 3-4 blocks away. Tastes MUCH better and is waaaay cheaper. Also FREE chips @ El Burrito Express!
author: Mel D.

description:
Decided to stop here last week because the cute decor inside. The restaurant itself is quite small, with a few tables and counters. 

My friend and I perused the menu while we stood in line waiting to order. This place is the type where you order/pay at the cashier and they bring your food to your table. I decided on one steak taco and one shrimp taco. The steak was juicy and came with pinto beans. The shrimp taco was a bit spicy - which they did not mention on the menu - but nonetheless delicious. The shrimp was cooked well and covered with a mango and jicama salsa. 

Food was affordable, and perfect if you're just looking for a quick bite and want to order a taco or two. 

Would definitely recommend
author: Melissa C.

description:
I was told to get the vegetarian burrito here. Definitely my kind of burrito. Not too dry, not too rich, not too heavy. I know, that's a theme for me...I cannot stand too rich :p

The beans were home made feeling and tasting. The roasted veggies werent just the usual roasted peppers and onions. There were root vegetables, yams!!!! It was quick pop in for lunch & the perfect amount of food for such an occasion. Will be back!
author: Lisa K.

description:
I got a tortilla soup!
It was exquisite!
No parking
3 tables to seat down
A middle bar table and some other side tables against the wall and window.
They have a bathroom though 
Food is good and prices all all right
author: Enrique R.

description: Both Fish tacos were outstanding!  Perfect walk from CPMC Pacific, Great vibe in the bright small space, great service!!!  Get some variety in the hot sauces and I'll camp out!
author: Jeff H.

description: How can you lose with a burrito? The Veracruz had a too salty overpowering cabbage slaw that was also so drippy that made this item impossible to eat. Waste!
author: lourdes l.

description: Fast service, friendly staff and great food! I've never had a bad experience at taco bar. Their shrimp and carnitas tacos are my favorite!!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Imagine my surprise when I order 25$ worth of food.. And my bill is 50$.
TWENTY SIX DOLLARS FOR A PITCHER OF MARGARITAS!? 
No ma'am. 
My fault for assuming they would be reasonably priced.. But come on.. It's like 75% sweet and sour mix!

Anyway.. 
The food was good.. Carnitas- super tasty. Taco salad.. Surprisingly tasty for a salad. Well done in the comida column. 

Bottom line.. Pricey.. This place is a bit pricey.. For 50$ dinner.. I (at least) need a fake candle on the table.
author: Sydney S.

description: The Baja Pescado with guac was absolutely incredible. I tried the Esquites, which was ok, but def just go with corn on the cob next time. Regardless - very tasty. The red wine sangria isn't too sweet - just perfect. Cute place and nice service.
author: Kristina W.

description: The food is good but the service that I received by a woman there was HORRIBLE!!!!! I work on Fillmore and all of the restaurants have amazing service, by far THE WORST service I've been experienced on Fillmore.  Not even worth going any more.
author: Julie O.

description: Best beef quesadilla ever. I am not a fan of Mexican cuisine, but their quesadilla keeps taking me back there.
author: Aram S.

description: Got the taco salad. The ingredients couldn't have been more fresh had I plucked them out the ground myself. Super crispy lettuce, light on the cheese, and flavorful. A good amount of guacamole. The taco shell was thick and healthy. Don't be expecting the light and fluffy fried type. The shell must have been baked. 10/10
author: Scarlet-Guliette B.

description: Ordered a Veracruz pescado taco. The fishy had a not in a good way fishy taste. A waste of money to me.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Hungry people on a business trip, staying in Pacific Heights, wandering the streets looking for food. Luckily, there are a lot of choices on Fillmore and California and the surrounding areas. When faced with the choice, we ducked into TacoBar to feast on a huge array of amazing food. At the table were chips, salsa, guacamole, burritos, quesadillas, tacos, beans, rice, horchata, cerveza... basically, we went big. 

I had a quesadilla camaron, which was filled with succulent shrimp and an abundance of cheese. I overate, absolutely, but between the guacamole and the salsa verde I kept smothering it in, I just couldn't stop! 

Everyone was totally fat and happy after our meal. The food came out quickly, was hot and tasty, and the service was good. It's a combo take-away/restaurant, which was great for our mid-afternoon lunching. 

Mexican food just gets better and better, the closer you are to the source.
author: Valerie S.

description:
Once in a blue moon, I get these intense cravings for fish tacos that are impossible to quell and it's just sad because when that happens, I'm nowhere near the Mission. 

Let me just get it out there, Tacobar is your frou-frou taco joint: you can find line-caught Mahi-Mahi here, their beef is from Piedmontese cows raised without any hormones, free-range chicken, etc, so you get my drift. Don't think it's not authentic, because it is and the flavors are well-balanced.

I've been here couple of times and normally get the baja pescado tacos. Beer battered Mahi Mahi with cabbage slaw, roasted Ancho chile salsa and lime sauce. The fish is always fresh and served piping hot. I don't even need additional green salsa from the squirt bottle because this is just perfect on its own. Their thick chips just have the right amount of salt and I always ask them not to put cheese because I pair mine with their creamy guac. Their carne asada burrito is a good choice as well, with more meat than rice ratio. Just be prepared to spend $$ because of the location.

The line moves quickly and service is decent. My only complaint?! please serve your sangria COLD. I don't want to add ice to it. That just kills my alcohol craving.
author: Janice C.

description: Came here for a late lunch and wasn't very impressed.  The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great.  I had the grilled fish tacos and my husband had chicken.  Not much to either, but my main complaint is I don't think they use homemade tortillas.  This is a big no no at any half decent Mexican place.  The margarita was a mix and tasted like tequila and fruit punch.  We were starved so the food did the trick- but I don't recommend if your looking for some fresh authentic Mexican.
author: Jackie R.

description: This mex spot is good. We had the shrimp tacos and shared a carne asada burrito. 2 modelos and we were set. A little on the pricey side but thats because we are used to getting good Mexican food at a taco truck for 1/4 of what we paid here lol. I will definitely come back though.
author: Tina M.

description: We always like the food - burritos for my son. I low-carb it with sides like carnitas, grilled fish, guac. The owner is a great guy as well.
author: Jim K.

description: The food is decent but the management is awful. The staff is so rude and disrespectful. Not worth the money. My family ordered for 5 people and we didn't get a copy of the receipt. When the food came we were missing one of the meals and when we asked the waiter where the last meal was they said we didn't order it (which we did). They asked to see a copy of our receipt but we didn't get one so they made us repurchase the meal! Going back through the price by price item afterwards we calculated that they overcharged us by $12. So not worth it
author: Samantha C.

description:
Duck confit taco was amazing - 4 stars. 

Veracruz burrito was bland - grilled fish usually has flavor...hmmm. Salsas are OK, but couldn't save the Veracruz. I feel like it should be listed as flavor-free on the menu. - 2 stars.

At least there's a bit of seating and you can sit outside the rare warm day. - 4 stars.

Prices are high. - 2 stars.

Yeah, Yelp is right, this really is a 3-star joint...
author: Ted R.

description:
Two burritos and chips to go: $30

Bone dry carnitas. 

Finally found the thimble worth of guacamole at the bottom. 

Fail.
author: Jason J.

description:
Sometimes you win.......... and sometimes you loose. I just finished writing a review of a very popular place that I found lacking. And it made me think, why not tell about the one that was good?

I smelled Tacobar before I saw it. My nose led me there. I'll sum it up for you.

FANTASTIC

They got it goin on. 
You won't be sorry.
author: Dave P.

description:
I've gotten food here several times, usually burittos, and it's always been "meh." Easiest Mexican food for me to get to, but only go there sparingly and the prices are quite high and it's nothing special.

Anyeay, this last time I went in I saw they had a special taco salad in a baked, whole wheat tortilla. I decided to get this (vegetarian). Now, there was absolutely NO MENTION of there being dressing in the description, so I assumed there wasn't any. Otherwise I would have asked for it on the side. Upon my first bite, I realized there was in fact dressing. Oh well, I thought. It's okay, I'll deal with it.  Upon going past the toppings and  deeper into the lettuce, I realized the salad was literally SMOTHERED in what tasted like Caesar dressing.

 I tried really hard to eat this salad anyway, but it was freaking NASTY there was so much dressing. I basically ended up picking out the beans and gaucamole (the cheese was too mixed in with the dressing) and eating about half of the shell (the only good part). The rest of the salad was pretty inedible. One of the most disappointing and unsatisfying meals I've had in a long, long time.
author: Elyse A.

description:
With a name like TacoBar, you better be good. Fortunately, TacoBar lives up to its name. There's nothing fancy about this Pac Heights taco stand. They do basic tacos (carne asadas, carnitas, chicken, fish, etc.). They all come served on a soft tortilla with your standard pinto beans, onions, and salsa. If you're looking for heartier fare, they also offer burritos, quesadillas, and tortas. I've tried their Tortilla soup and their Avocado Ensalada Caesar, and both were quite tasty and filling. But mostly, I just stick with the tacos - especially the Baja Pescado tacos (Tempura beer battered mahi mahi, with cabbage slaw, roasted Ancho salsa and lime sauce). They usually come out in under five minutes in a plastic basket paired with two ketchup dispensers full of green and red salsa. I usually wolf my meal down in 5 minutes and then I'm out the door to embark on my next adventure.

TacoBar's service is always quick and friendly. My only complaint about the place is that they list the menu items on the wall without their prices. Not sure I understand the strategy behind this tactic. Why are you trying to keep your prices secret from the customers? Also, it's unclear to me whether I'm supposed to bus my own table when I'm done. Last time I was there, I handed my dirty plate to the taco technician and he gave me a  "Dude, why are you giving me your dirty plate? Can't you see I'm busy?" kind of look. Oh well, these are minor complaints. I'm going to keep coming back here when I need my quick taco fix.

BTW, if you're worried about parking, they have a lot on California St. @ Fillmore (adjacent to Pizzeria Delfina), or you can always park illegally at Mollie Stone's. Though don't blame if you get towed.
:  )
author: Kevin B.

description: Best fish taco I have ever had. Fresh and crispy and amazing. Shrimp taco special was also outstanding. Service is great. People are so nice. I have a lot of food allergies and they made sure they could take care of me. Love this place. :)
author: Sandra S.

description: Trust the reviews and skip this place - that's what I should've done. Ordered a torta ($10) and got a sandwich that looked like it was assembled by a 5th grader (tasted like it too). Chips that came with it were cold and hard.
author: Garima T.

description: Dont know why I paid $20 for a shitty taco and an even shittier michelada.... I wasnt offered a receipt or told if anything was an extra charge. The menu said $4.50 for a taco... was the Michelada $15?? Very disappointed. Will never return.
author: Amelia S.

description:
This place is great! Nachos... Great! Taco Salad... Great. Baja Shrimp Taco... Insanely Great!

One of the best Mexican joints I've found in San Francisco.
author: Zach B.

description: Over priced. Stingy on Salsa and Guacamole. Stale chips. Dry Carnitas. Bottom line, this is San Francisco, there are tons of great burritos joints. This isn't one of them.
author: Ryan S.

description: Food is decent and for the price it would not be my first go to place. The staff and the prompt service really astounds me but that without the components of good food it really does not deserve my 4 stars.  It could be a place to try again just to see if the other menu items are good. I had the quesadilla Carne asada and it was pretty bland... there were no wow factors to the food and the texture. I ordered a small horchata, small quesadilla, and chips with quac  and pica de gallo came out to 19.20. Just to give you an idea.
author: Nikole D.

description:
Coming from New York where they don't have the best Mexican food, I'm not a burrito snob. But I do like to eat and I like yummy things! So based on my own standards, these burritos are really good! Their carne asada is so tender and makes a tasty and filling burrito with the rice and beans. My favorite is their pescado! The fish has a nice soft crunch and is soft and flavorful on the inside. 

I probably wouldn't recommend their cameron burrito-- I tasted more cabbage slaw than the prawns so it was more like just a cabbage burrito. Not a huge fan of cabbage in general, but their cabbage slaw is okay, although tangier than I'd like it. Another problem I have is that the amount of guacamole that they give is really inconsistent-- the first time I received a generous spread of guac and the second time I could hardly taste it. I think they skimped on the beef the second time too :(. I'll assume it was an off day or I guess it depends on who prepares the food. 

Other than those issues, I really love how fresh and clean their ingredients taste. Food comes out fast and warm! Their servings are a good size and definitely leaves me feeling full and satisfied!
author: Hannah P.

description:
PLEASE make the Baja shrimp tacos a regular menu item! We've tried the other tacos and they are inferior in comparison! Love the outdoor seating option so the dogs can join in on the fun! Delicious sangria and margaritas!

UPDATE!! The Baja shrimp taco can be made into a BURRITO for $10!!! So much food but sooo excellent and much easier (read less messy) to eat than the tacos
author: Amanda H.

description:
I came here for lunch. As far as the style of food, it's Mexican with a California cuisine flare. 

I had a Torta sandwich with carne asada. The meat was slow roasted and moist. The toppings were really fresh. It was like a burrito in between bread. My husband became a fan of their fish tacos. They are more Baja style (aka deep fried) and a little bit different than what I've experienced in Mexico but good in their own way. Their chips and beans were very fresh. 

It's good if you adjust your expectation to their style. It's just a small place with sit down seating that is good for people on the run. It's close to my medical facility so it's really convenient. Extra added bonus points for some vegetarian options.
author: Tanja F.

description:
Very delicious!

We stopped in before I was headed to the airport for a quick bite... I had the breakfast burrito with eggs & rice. I really wanted the one with chorizo, but decided that eating chorizo before boarding a 5-hour flight wasn't the BEST idea! My lunch buddy had the shrimp tacos, and we shared an order of chips/guacamole. 

I loved the breakfast burrito... I admit that I am super sensitive to spicy things, and this was on the low-end of my spice tolerance levels. My friend said the shrimp tacos, however, were probably way out of the range of anything I could eat safely! He said they were great, but very, very spicy. The guacamole was super fresh & the chips were the perfect kind, salty & super crispy. 

Definitely a little pricey for a quick taco lunch, but everything was great & the service was super fast.
author: Karen C.

description:
Always walked by in Pac Heights but it's the first time I walked in.

I ordered two tacos: carnitas (comes with pinto beans and lettuce) and line caught pescado taco. 

Not much to it- ambiance was like any other super casual restaurant and the tacos were not phenomenally special- they were good. 

I would order here again if was in the neighborhood.
author: Sarah K.

description: Underwhelming and overpriced. $20 for two tacos and a quesadilla filled with mostly beans and pico de gallo. It's interesting that they don't list the prices on their menu.
author: Eric W.

description: Quick and yummy! Vegan options available. There was a long line but it moved quickly. Best to grab a table outside, there seemed to be more room than the inside tables.
author: Ashley F.

description:
We had parking right out front so we gave this one a go after watching a movie at Kabuki.

One doesn't come to a place called "TacoBar" expecting authentic Mexican food on Fillmore St. Food was so-so for me. Slightly bland. The veggie tacos wrapped in the flour tortilla and then covered in a cheese hard shell was probably one of the better here. I was though disappointed by the nachos. The flavors just weren't there for me. 

Friendly employees. Slightly steep prices.
author: Esther A.

description: I came for the location and pitcher of sangria, not so much for the food. If you snag a table outside, on the sidewalk to see and be seen with your nachos stacked with guac, it is quite worth the overpriced mediocre taco and quesadilla. Flavors fell a bit flat. Otherwise I do give a nod to the exciting interior color splash
author: Grace O.

description: Stopped by for lunch and was dissapointed.  We had tacos which had more beans than meat. The flavor was ok but I would not come back.
author: Laurie R.

description: I went here for lunch yesterday and was greatly surprised. I had the taco salad with chicken. Awesome! Very fresh--didn't expect that. Definitely plan to continue going. Love that it's so healthy.
author: Dianne N.

description: This place is a complete joke. The food is way over priced and the portion size is crazy small for what you pay. The service is sub par. Save your money and time, go to the mission.
author: David M.

description:
3.5 stars

I found this place to have very large portions - I couldn't finish half of my 4-cheese quesadilla.  Chips were great - reminded me more of stacy's pita chips actually. Would return since it's close to me and doesn't require reservations or a line for brunch.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Just left this place at 10 PM. Place wasn't closing yet but a lady was sweeping up very aggressively & my friend & I both started sneezing. We left & I said something to her about it -- "doing it more slowly might not throw stuff up in the air" -- she apologized-- and then as we left went right back to doing that around other diners who had just sat down next to us. RUDE! My friend was STILL sneezing after we got in the car. 
They switched the labels on our burritos-- so I ended up with meat in my mouth instead of fish... not OK... I don't eat meat. 
The burritos were ok, but the tortillas were white & gummy. Made them Especial but could barely find any cheese & no avocado at all. NOTHING here to recommend. Pitcher of Sangria did not taste of ANY alcohol at all. 
$68.00 for this? and Attitude with the service. Paid $8 tip with the order at the counter -- but that was a total waste! Not the way to end a Friday night.
author: Philip W.

description: If I could give them a zero, I would.  This is one of the worst Mexican restaurants I've ever been to and the most expensive.  The tortilla soup cost close to $9 and was terrible.  Basically nothing in it, except little tiny tiny cubes of chicken.  The chicken burrito I ordered gave me an upset stomach.  And I've been taking the pink stuff for two days now.  Do yourself a favor, run to the border and go to Taco Bell.  This place sucks and rips you off financially.
author: Terry S.

description:
On our way to the Kabuki to see Prometheus a few weeks back, we stumbled upon TacoBar. The smells of carne asada and carnitas drew us in and we were warmly welcomed by the staff.

Now, anyone who knows me, knows that I LOVE Mexican food. I was excited that we came upon this place but I wasn't so excited about the prices. For standard street tacos, we paid a pretty penny ($3.45/each), however the tacos were pretty good! Not great, but good. I had the carnitas tacos and the carnitas were juicy and tender, not dry at all. The boyfriend had some fish tacos, made with Mahi Mahi ($3.75/each), which were delicious! The tacos came with pinto beans and pico de gallo.

I think if you're in the Pac Heights area, TacoBar is a solid spot to grab a quick bite. However, like other Mexican restaurants outside of the Mission, I just wouldn't make the trek out there.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I'm a big fan of takeout from this place. Like most restaurants on Fillmore this place is  a bit overpriced, but this place still gets 4 stars for quality food.

I usually go with the quesadilla (carnitas or carne asada) with the sour cream and guac added in. This is a hefty quesadilla, and can be a meal on its own.

This is one of those places where you order at the counter and you're given a card so that they can deliver food to your table. The line can get a bit long but I don't think I've ever had trouble finding a seat, as there is a lot of take-out traffic (myself included).
author: Jack H.

description: I'm sad to say that taco bar lost my business today.  I live in the area and go there frequently for their steak quesadilla especial. My friends always hassled me because I would pay $10 for my quesadilla, over-priced, but worth it.  Today I paid almost $14 for that very same quesadilla.  I get that the costs in the city are rising, but I just can't justify a $14 quesadilla anymore...
author: D D.

description:
I'm afraid I'll have to second what everyone says about this place: good for your basic taco or burrito. Nothing particularly spectacular about this place, but if you're craving Mexican and happen to be in the area I'd say this place will satisfy you enough. 

I had their breakfast burrito most recently: Chorizo and egg. It was good, but again nothing special.
author: Chris T.

description: Love the Baja Fish Taco! The sangria was tasty but a little weak. Seating can be a little challenging on a busy afternoon but usually something opens up pretty quickly. I'll be back!
author: C.L. L.

description:
Me and the lady were craving some tacos and wanted to stay local. We called in at 8:50 and they closed at 9. They told us it would be ready in 5 min so we drove over and our food was waiting when I ran in. The nice lady at the front read back my order and made sure everything was right. We can be pretty picky on our orders, so I appreciate her checking to make sure it was all correct. They run a good pickup service and that's why they get my vote of approval. 

Some of the best salsa in the area, the food hit the spot too.
author: Mark M.

description:
This is my go-to place to grab a burrito (not that there are many places in Pacific Heights), and while it isn't the best burrito you'll ever have, it's really solid. 

The carnitas are fresh and not fatty, but usually I get a veggie burrito. They have a good Jarritos selection and alright margaritas. The taco salad isn't great. Really, the take-away here is to stick with a burrito. 

Not a destination taqueria, but a great local place. The best feature is that the chips and salsa come with pico de gallo style salsa, plus 2 hot sauces (green/tomatillo and a smoky red), AND crumbled cojita cheese. It's a big step up from the standard chips and salsa at most places, where the quality of the chips is an afterthought.
author: Laura J.

description: Tacobar's Veracruz pescado burrito is the jam -- I've probably eaten them 100 times here!  Add a little pico de gallo and OMG!!  Service is quick and always friendly.  Food is always fresh, colorful, and delicious.  Great, casual little neighborhood restaurant.  Excellent for carry out too!
author: Emily W.

description: Good food.  Good service.  Consistent.  I wish they would have a few more vegetarian options.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I really wish someone else would take over this location because it's just a waste for this place to be here.  I wish it was a healthy, organic Mexican restaurant, but it just was terrible. 

The fish tacos we had consisted of a piece of fish on top of some cabbage (supposed to be slaw) and corn tortilla. There was no salsa, no flavor and it just seemed sad and frankly unacceptable.  

The Jicama salad was just some chopped jicama, a few pieces of avocado, some nuts and tangerine, no dressing or flavor.  Not quite sure why the nuts were there either. 

We each had 2 tacos, the jicama salad, and chios and guacamole, which also was lacking in flavor, just seemed like some avocado mashed up.  For $27 there are plenty of better places in the area with food that actually tastes great.
author: Inga W.

description:
Date & Time:  Wednesday April 14, 2010 @ 1pm 
Dining Companions:  Dana & Janie
Scene:  Well-Heeled Pairs of Young Ladies in Elizabeth Charles Dresses  & Guys in Blazers, Thomas Pink Shirts, Jeans & Loafers
Vibe:  Chill
Decor:  Bright & Cheery.  Edison Lighting.  Mosaic Patterned Walls.  Communal Table, Cushioned Bench, Counter-Seating & Dining Al Fresco
Service:  Very, Very Nice & Humble
Imbibe:  Jamaica Agua Fresca.  Mango & Horchata Agua Fresca, Magarita & Sangrias Available
Mediocre: Pollo Burrito, Carne Asada Tacos & Coconut Flan
Devour:  Shrimp Taco & Grilled Shrimp
Total:  $32.41
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
I always get a taco salad with carnitas to go.  And it's always delicious.

This is a pretty small space on the corner, and even though I've only gone on weeknights it tends to be fairly full with diners so you  may have more luck opting for takeout.  The menu seems to offer your standard range of tacos, dillas, burritos, and sides/others.  I should someday try the tacos since they are the namesake item, but I'm a fan of tostadas so it may be hard for me to make the switch.
