It was a bit pricey but im going to say its worth it for the fresh ingredients alone, usually after eating a big burritto im left with a lump in my stomach, not here, i felt satisfied and happy! 
TRY IT!
author: David R.

description:
This gets two stars because the carne asada taco was actually good.  But do not go here thinking you are getting authentic mexican food.  I was extremely disappointed at how bland the shrimp taco was.  It was like they used no seasoning at all.  There are no rice and beans included  and chips and salsa are extra.  I also order a lime margarita which they tried to blend but came out with large chunks of ice in it.  I was not asked if I wanted it blended either, I guess that's the only way they serve them?

This place is expensive and what you get is simply not worth it.  If they want the price to be worth it for their customers while keeping the portions the same, they seriously need to amp up the flavor.  I will not return to this place.
author: Anne D.

description: Love this gem of a spot on Fillmore!  Great guac, burritos and lunch atmosphere!  They do catering too.
author: Samantha A.

description:
Great local spot.  Some claim TacoBar is expensive for a mexican joint, but this is not a taqueria!  Fresh organic ingredients, great ambiance, tasty drinks and very friendly staff earns this place five stars.  

Would a taqueria have duck confit tacos?  I don't thinks so...

Pretty much everything on their menu is delicious, try the grilled fish tacos and massive burritos "especial" style, but don't pass up the opportunity to dig into one of their weekly specials...
author: Chris G.

description: I've grown inordinately fond of this little spot.  Is it possible for take-out to be better than food consumed on the premises?  Well, today it was.  We decided to do a last-minute office lunch and placed an order for pick up.  (Don't even try to call before 11:30.)  Great baja pescado tacos, crispy little side salad, and that cup of corn.  Yum.
author: Robert M.

description: 9:bucks for two carne asada tacos? Such a rip off! They should at least taste amazing at that price by they were so average. Save your time and money and do not come here..
author: Jay M.

description:
**gluten-free friendly**

Be creative with what you order, and there are quite a few things someone who is gluten-intolerant can eat!  I had the vegetarian burrito without the wrap, over rice instead.  The portions were a little small, but the food was tasty!
author: Missy W.

description: Just okay. Nothing special and for some reason I thought it would be like a salad bar where you can choose different tacos. My bad. The space is cute, modern, interesting plants. Food is okay.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Great, fresh, organic food...excellent agua frescas, innovative specials and a very responsive, nice staff. 

The fish tacos are delicious and they make incredible quesadillas (the only place in the world where I'll order them). 

Top notch!
author: Ben C.

description:
Location Location Location -- top notch
Food Flavor Taste -- ugh... not so much.

Came to check out one of the recent additions to the neighborhood.  Located at the corner of Fillmore and California, it's one of the most prized locations in the area.

Had a chicken burrito (with black beans).  Found it salty and bland.  Oxymoron? Perhaps. But that's what my mouth told me. It rarely lies. Although it searched for other flavors, my tastebuds were overwhelmed by the saltiness.

Quite pricey too for what you get.  However, it was clean and well-kept.

If they could only bring in a mexican joint to that location that can also be known for good food.  That corner is tracking 0 for 2 so far...
author: Carol K.

description: Absolutely the best shrimp taco I have ever tasted.  The shrimp are tender (unlike the usual rubber bullets served in tacos) and the ancho salsa makes it.  They could do this as a dinner, shrimp with rice and beans, and get lots of money, but as a taco it's only $3.95.  Amazing
author: Marcia P.

description:
Wow, so far not so good on the yelp front with this place. There's not much texmex/mexicali food on Fillmore so we were pretty happy when they got rid of that chain burrito place and we got Tacobar. 

We ordered the Carnitas burrito and the steak taco especial. We enjoyed both. The taco filled me up despite what I was imagining. 

The inside decor is cool but the outside still doesn't look done. And yeah, their prices are a few dollar more than what the food calls for.
author: Sarah D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place as we need some decent Mexican on Fillmore,  Unfortunately my fish burrito was 
 - Fishy, not fresh
 - Incredibly salty
 - Greasy and wet.  
The cabbage slaw soaked through the bottom of the burrito immediately. Maybe I ordered wrong?  Still, at a minimum I'd expect edible and enjoyable, even if it's not memorable or worthy of repeat.  I recommend going elsewhere!
author: Sharon G.

description:
The carnitas taco was too dry & without flavor.  The tortilla was ok but I've definitely had better in the city.  I did appreciate the decor & the use of a compost bin/compostable utensils but as others have said, $7 for a carnitas taco with guac & fancy fried cheese....I don't think I'll be returning. 

Someone did have some tasty looking tortilla soup next to me.  Looked like a good portion for the price--maybe try that if you go.
author: Laura F.

description: Unlike Tacko down the road, Tacobar is not impressive gringo mexican food. It is mediocre and over priced. It's just OK. The food is well prepared but unimaginative. In a town with such a selection of taquerias and burrito joints, it's a shame that getting good mexican food is so difficult the closer you get to the GG bridge.
author: Zac H.

description:
I will admit, I am not a major taco eater, so my review may not live up to what others might say who love tacos.

Went in for a quick snack after hiking 5 miles yesterday.  Ordered the nachos, a fish taco and one carnitas taco.  The nachos were fine.  The fish taco had very little flavor.  The carnitas taco really lacked the great flavor you expect from the carnitas.  Nothing really spiked my interest that I would come rushing back to eat here again.

One quick side note, someone mentioned the Organic Free Range Chicken in their review.  The chicken is only free range and not organic.  I appreciate their trying to serve organic/humane foods, but they need to ensure the flavors are there as well.
author: Markus S.

description:
Ditto on what so many reviews before me are saying...

Felt ripped off with the measly taco I ordered and side of corn. NINE dollars! The corn was watery as thought it had been defrosted in the freezer and the pinch of cotija cheese on top was just an afterthought. The fish taco I ate in one bite. 

I will say that my friend was delighted by her super burrito. If it weren't for her walking out satisfied this would be a one star review for sure.
author: Ash E.

description: Anyone with the guts to serve duck confit tacos gets my respect (and a return visit). Delicious. The chips were fresh and homemade. The salsa was tasty, if a tad mild. The staff  were friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome.
author: karen c.

description: If you really like Mexican food, don't go here.  Food isn't flavorful and you pay too much for it. Everything Mexican food shouldn't be- bland and expensive.
author: Patty H.

description:
I have to admit, I was initially frightened by the long pieces of wood hanging from a wall inside TacoBar with little bits of plants protruding from them. 
Chips & salsa (I think the chips were house made) were probably the best of my dinner; a pomegranate margarita was decent, as were the mahi mahi tacos which were quite a sloppy handful with all of the ingredients bursting from them.
I liked that there was bench seating with pillows and an actual bar you could sit out looking onto the street. 
Nothing mind blowing - just a decent taco bar.
author: Adriana K.

description:
Definitely not a destination restaurant, but an easy place to grab quick, fresh food in the neighborhood. 

Quality ingredients. Order the guac (it's decent and the best you're gonna get on Fillmore) and the baja pescada tacos.  Don't order the burritos or quesadillas
author: Jennifer B.

description:
This little taco bar located at the corner of California and Fillmore offers up some fairly nice Mexican food considering the part of my beloved new hometown in which it is situated.

I have enjoyed the fish tacos (grilled; not battered), carnitas burros (burritos) and chicken quesadilla.  My only suggestion would be that TacoBar contemplate pulling rather than cube dicing the chicken wrapped in their quesadilla.

Oh, to those who complain about price, go to McDonalds.  It's not inexpensive to plate flavourful food and, consequently, the customer will pay or they'll go to McDonalds or something similar..
author: Jay D.

description:
New mex in the hood so I gave it a chance...a friend and I shared tortilla chips & guac, carne asada burrito, chicken taco, veracruz fish taco and a mango juice drink. Total price: 40$ (includes tip).

Pretty much all the dishes were bland, especially their guacamole. I had to pour the green hot sauce on everything to give it some kick.

Veracruz fish taco was my fav. I came back and had the Veracruz Pescado burrito.  The fish was fresh and well spiced. The taste reminded me of the authentic Mexican food I've had in Sayulita.

3 starts for the fish dishes at TacoBar!
author: Joahnna M.

description:
I've walked by this place almost every day since it opened earlier this year, and I FINALLY decided to try it today.  I wasn't in a rush since I've heard it's overpriced and nothing special.  They were right.  

I ordered the Baja Pescado Taco "Especial", which cost me almost $6.  It had one piece of over-fried fish in the taco and some kind of cheese disc which they wrapped in foil and put on the side.  In my opinion, Rubio's fish tacos taste better and are half the price.  

One plus, though, is the service.  Everyone from the waitress to the cashier were super friendly.  I might come here again if I'm in a Mexican-craving moment since it's convenient.
author: Tina F.

description: Sopa de tortilla (yeah, that's tortilla soup) is excellent here. Tacos are much more of a *** thing - I prefer El Tonayense - but the soup is *great*
author: Bowen D.

description: Food is so so and it's WAY overpriced.  I got a cup of soup with mostly broth in it today and it cost me $10.  Ridiculous. Should've kept walking to Mollie Stone.
author: Honest A.

description:
The only thing I like about TacoBar is that they have a plant installation designed by Flora Grubb.  I buy plants at the Flora Grubb Grubb Gardens.  Tells you something when the only reason to go to Taco Bar is to check out the hanging wall fauna...

Other than that, I've had a lot of way better white people tacos in my life. Let me give you some options 1) Cactus and 2) Tacolicious.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I will keep this review short and sweet. I wish La Salsa were back instead of this place. 

The food is overpriced and bland. At least La Salsa was cheap and bland. Also, no free chips? That's lame.  They have some nice extras I guess like ice cream and drinks, but who cares if the food isn't good.  I read a lot of the reviews and still tried it just to have my own opinion, but I found the reviews to be accurate. I think this place will do okay just because of its location and the high amount of folks that will walk by there an not know any better, but I would head to another spot if you care at all about the Mexican food you put in your mouth. 

My two cents.
author: Matthew F.

description:
I would come back here.  I see several posts about this place being overpriced, and if they're talking about the buritto they're right.  Expensive for something not so special.

But the tacos are actually kinda cheap for what you get.  Vegetarian taco was only 3.15.  You buy one, and they overstuff it so much, and give you 2 tortillas, that you're basically getting 2 tacos for 3.15, which is ok by me.  Agua fresca was really good too.

The music was too loud though, that was annoying.
author: Phil J.

description:
Loved it! Great, fresh ingredients and delicious food. Quesadillas are identical to Nick's on Polk, except the steak is more flavorful (more pepper) - absolutely loved it. 

No, it's not the Mission. $5 burritos with questionable ingredients = Mission. $9 burritos with delicious freshness (and walking distance for peeps like me) = TacoBar in Pac Hts. 

Well done.
author: Kirsten B.

description:
I'm not much for being negative nancy or any kind of food snob but geez Taco Bar, you need to step it up a notch, especially since you have prime Fillmore real-estate. 

I found the place to expensive for what you get. Even though the portion size was decent, they were still missing the most important factor when dining out,  the "taste factor" (nada de nada amigos, this grub was bland).  I ordered a soap.... OOP's sorry I mean a soup, and it seriously tasted like something that came out of a can that had been stored in the cupboards since the prohibition era. The worst part was I went with a couple of gf's who happen to live in the neighborhood and are Mexicans. I asked them why in the world being Mexican they would bring me to a place that even they had previous bad experiences with? Their statement was very  optimistic, they hoped  that somehow it had gotten better, since they knew the place was still pretty new and they were obviously still trying to work some things out. Overall Kudos to my GF's for being such good sports, but this Latin Chica will probably not be returning to Taco Barf, geez I just keep messing up today, I meant Taco Bar. 

p.s Also the place gets at times very crowed and there isn't enough elbow clearance space.
author: Lannette G.

description:
I've tried...tried so hard to like this place and it always falls flat.

The chicken quesadilla is interesting and good but a deceivingly heavy meal AND not cheap.  Should cost about 20% less.

I sucked it up and gave them another shot last week with a single fish taco and it was just sad.  Not very tasty and about $4+ w/ tax.  For nearly the same money, I should have gone to Woodhouse across the street.

Also, they're astonishingly slow for takeout Mexican.  The best thing this place has going for it is my daily 2pm revelation that I'm starving combined with their location. 

Avoid unless desperate.
author: Arnie P.

description:
I was eager to check this restaurant ever since it opened a few months ago and had the opportunity today but was rather disappointed. 

We ended up ordering a vegetarian burrito and a vegetarian taco because those were the only veggie items besides the cheese quesadilla.  The burrito had some pinto beans, rice and some salsa in it but I thought it was rather bland and I could mostly taste the beans and flour tortillas. Tacos had some fried cheese in it and was rather bland. The person who took my order told me that there were two tacos but I realized it was just one taco with two soft shells. What a rip off as it cost 4.75.  The burrito cost 8 bucks and chips are not on the house. I ordered chips and salsa and paid 2.99 but the person was still asking me if I wanted salsa. The salsa was bland and not even sufficient for the chips I ordered. I had to eat the chips with the red and green sauce. 


The lady who came to clean the table asked us if we enjoyed the food and my wife told her that the food was okay. So i told her that I was not expecting fried cheese in my taco and she told this to the owner or chef. The owner stopped by and told us that it is mentioned on the menu and walked away. I mean the point was not even whether its on the menu or not but it seemed like the owner was just trying to defend or avoid getting  a bad review. 

I wouldn't go back to this place unless they improve the food and not charge 5 bucks for a taco with just rice, beans and some guac.
author: Rahul P.

description: Not impressed. Bland n skimpy portions later I vowed never to go back.
author: Natasha I.

description:
Skip the tacos, skip the burritos, get the quesadilla!!! 

Yes, this place is pricey but, good lord, they give you a lot of food. Normally, when you think of a quesadilla, you think of a mostly-flat, tortilla and cheese concoction. But no, not at TacoBar. Their quesadilla is basically a burrito with a nicely crisped tortilla. And tastes much much better than their burritos, which I think are pretty boring as other Yelpers have said.

Their tacos are crazy huge, but should be at $5+ each. They are stuffed with meat, probably enough to make 3 normal-sized tacos. 

I'd go again but keep in mind that not everything on their menu is good, so order with caution.
author: Jen P.

description: Came here with some co-workers for a quick bite to eat. Didn't really expect much considering I was VERY hungry. Place is small, but quaint. I had the baja pescada, carne asada, and camarones. The spicy, tangy sauce that they add on top of the baja is pretty tasty. The tacos were delicious. The margarita, on the other hand, I felt was a little too overpriced for the size they give you. The elote made my experience all the better because, well, who doesn't love elote paired with fresh margarita when you get off work? I would try other tacquerias in the area but if you want a quick bite, this is an ok spot.
author: Ana B.

description:
Everything I felt about this place has already been written, but I want to lower this place's ratings so I can save others from spending an exorbitant amount on a crappy Mexican lunch.

I had the vegetarian taco and my boyfriend had the veracruz pescado burro. Also bought the totopos (chips) and salsa. The big theme here is BLAND but the other is EXPENSIVE. How do they manage to make wonderful Mexican food made with organic ingredients taste so flavorless? Also, no free chips - paid $2.95 for a small bowl of chips and tasteless pico de gallo. In all, paid $22 for a tiny lunch for two people that I would have paid probably less than $10 for at Pancho Villa in the Mission and it would have tasted way better. 

On top of that, when we finally snagged a table outside, it was filled with someone else's dirty dishes with no bussing service in sight. I ended up bussing the table myself to someone inside - two trips - but at least the hostess/waitress thanked me cheerfully both times. 

Bottom line: at $5 for a bland taco, save your money and pray for the return of La Salsa.
author: G O.

description:
I like this place....a lot.

I ordered the carne asada quesadilla with the "especial" (guac and sour cream) and the chips and salsa to split with the bf.

Chips, high quality, great, crunchy, tasty, salty....mmmmm with salsa where the tomatoes were actually fresh.  Yes, it could be spicier but I'll take fresh, organic (or so I'm told), delicious salsa anyday over three day old pink, chewy tomato salsa.  The quesadilla was fantastic with a crispy, toasted flour tortilla.  I don't usually order carne asada but I chanced it this time.  The flavor was great and it wasn't gristly.  Sure, it's "funny shaped"  to what most people are used to but it's still a damn 'dilla.  Meat, cheese, guac and sour cream.  It's filling, but not in that nasty, greasy, cheese oil down my face kind of way.  In fact, I ate 7 hours ago and I'm just starting to get hungry again.

Minus one star for being SUPER expensive.  I get that it is fresh, organic, etc but my bill was $31 for a burrito, quesadilla, chips, and a couple of drinks....plus tip.
author: Gemma S.

description: Solid mexican on Fillmore.  The chips are great, a little too much guac on the tacos, (i am picky about too much guac) but fresh food and good for a mexican fix.  I like the quick-service concept and location, Fillmore needs a mexican joint other than the chain that preceded Tacobar.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Honestly, this place shouldn't ever recieve more than three stars because of two specific reasons. 

1. For serving the most basic taqueria style Mexican Food, drop your prices or this place will not last very long

2. If the customers are gonna pay close to ten bucks worth of tacos, then at least make them bigger and more tasty
author: Marty F.

description: I love the friendly staff. They are always very helpful and attentive. The meat in the tacos is very flavorful and I overall enjoy visiting.
author: Julianne L.

description:
I came across this place last week and I ordered a vegetarian burrito. The woman behind the register and a couple other employees I interacted with were friendly and relaxed.

The burrito was pricey, but if you go to most any taco shop or Mex. restaurant and add all the toppings that are included on this burrito, you will come out to a similar price.  I liked the flavors overall.  I would have liked less rice and more beans.  The ingredients were very fresh.  The burrito was HUGE.  You could cut it in half and use it for two meals if you wanted to.  Ideally, I'd share a veggie burrito with a friend and maybe have a taco or quesadilla as well.

The salsa verde was good.  I liked the chipotle red sauce as well, but not everyone likes chipotle so another straight-up spicy red sauce would be nice.

I'll try TacoBar again next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Mark C.

description: The food was pretty good and no bargain, but the service was exceptional.  The staff, especially the owner (or manager) really seemed to care about his customers having a good experience there.
author: Jane D.

description: The artisan cooks at taco bar haven't invented  anything, rather they have stayed true to Mexican food in it's purest form, using top notch meats and homemade salsa you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The specials are always amazing and don't be affraid to let the friendly staff help you pick. A must if your in the area and looking for a great eat!
author: Brett R.

description: CHIPS & SALSA EXTRA?!?! That's like charging for bread at an Italian restaurant.   If I'm paying $4 for a small taco they could at least throw in some chips & salsa.  Skip this place and look for a Baja Fresh!!!!!
author: Carlos Q.

description: The WORST carnitas in the world. I didn't order carnitas with diced tomatoes and red beans, I ordered carnitas, it's suppose to be straight-up diced pieces of pork. And they charge $4.95 for one. I don't mind spending the money if it's GOOD, this place sucks. I was hungry and walked in because it looked cute from the outside. It was also so bland, and they gave me two salsas to use and they were equally bland. Great for the tourists and Americans who can't eat anything unusual.
author: Annee E.

description: Terrible place, pricy for what you get no even chips they gave out .  The burritos are tasteless with cabbage slaw? What the hell!  I do not recommend this at all!
author: Lex M.

description:
Certain types of restaurants should be sampled by certain types of food. For taco places it is the Carne Asada Burrito. I bought one and was disappointed by several factors. First off the price. It was $8.50 Were this to be a super burrito that would be a good price, but it wasn't. Second of all the size. It was very understuffed, which resulted in a big wedge of tortilla tucked on the side. As far as the composition of the burrito. It was alright, simple but it was well crafted.

Other then the mediocre burrito, another that bothered me was the lack of complimentary tortilla chips. This was the first taco place i have ever been to to not give tortilla chips with the meal. The salsa was there but there were no chips.

Not to be completely negative, The interior of the restaurant was nice. They were also kind enough to have a pitcher of water with lime for use.
author: Eric B.

description: Best fish tacos!!! We love this place, I really don't understand the poor reviews. First off if you complain about the size of the taco you need to go back to Chevys or Taco Bell, this is the normal size of a mexican taco! Secondly if your complaining about the price, have you ever eaten in SF? its not cheap any where here! The prices here are resonable for the area. My fiancee and I ate there last night for 30$, we left pleanty full! And lastly the food is amazing, I haven't yet had anything that didn't knock my socks off. Great flavor and spice, plus I love the sauce they bring to your table so you can use as much as you want(my fav is the green one!) Not to mention they have the best Aqua Fresca!! I have tried the watermelon and the pinnapple- to die for! All in all this is one of my favorite stops to make, even if we aren't in pac heights we will drive all the way from Ingleside if the craving strikes! WE LOVE TACO BAR!! great I was just there last night and I already want to go back after writing this review!
author: Jessica F.

description: Small place, but I like the way they have set it up. Staff was very nice and I was in and out in no time (dinner for take out). The chicken burrito was delicious. Not too spicy and the ingredients seemed to be fresh.
author: Linda S.

description: I arrived on a busy thursday evening and I received prompt and courteous service.  Very yummy food! I had the Baja pescado tacos, chips and guacamole.  I grew up in San Diego and I consider myself a Mexican food snob.  When traveling to other areas I typically avoid Mexican places because they never stack up.  I've tried other places in the bay area and have never been thrilled, but I would definitely come back.
author: Sara R.

description: Don't mean to be so hyperbolic but tacobar has the best vegetarian taco I have ever had. I've also been impressed with their other tacos, sangria, guacamole, etc - but keep coming back to the veggie taco because it is so unique and good. Great place for a quick bite, great outside seating, friendly staff, great location on Fillmore. Can't recommend it enough for a quick bite!
author: Janet O.

description: Probably the best mexican in the city, and trust me I've lived here long enough to know. The staff knows me (I go least one time a week) The salsa verde is TO DIE FOR!!! My favorites are the shrimp quesadilla, the beef burrito, and the chicken tacos. Only the tortas are not so good.
author: Henry W.

description: Went to Tacobar after checking out the other restaurants/cafes in the area. It was different, so I decided to try it. It was delicious. I had a carne asada quesadilla especial and it was one of the best ones I've ever had. The meat was flavorfully marinated and not too soft/hard. The guac was good and the salsa was spicy enough but not too spicy. The tortilla was toasted, which I love, and it came out looking more like a burrito than your typical quesadilla, which I didn't mind. I was in a hurry so I saved the rest. It was even more delicious as leftovers. Too bad I live in San Jose because I'd go there so often.
author: Ros H.

description: Tried the pollo and fried fish taco's... pollo was okay fish was decent. I did like the sauce however. The guac is really good. A client recommended this over the taco truck in fremont across the bank of america...NO way... tacos and anywhere near Fremont you need to be at the truck across of bofa on Fremont blvd.
author: Mohammed G.

description: A better offering than the previous La Salsa tenant. Classy tin ceilings and ornate tile work adds to a south of the border decor. The carne asada burro was super clean and fresh tasting. Not the biggest by any means, but really-how thick do you need your meat log to be?
author: Sam N.

description: Taco bar is that tex mex kind of place. You aren;t gonna get anything authentic here but you will get flavor and you will definitely get full. Their nachos are really good. I could just have that to myself honestly but we ordered it as an appetizer. Their tacos are decent but really I prefer the real thing taco truck status. Overall its a cool place and the people are really really friendly. BUT i really don't know how I feel paying amost $4 for a taco...i dunno if i can stomach that when Im so used to tacos being cheap.
author: Sheila C.

description: I had a really great breakfast burrito at Taco Bar. The burrito was flavorful without being too spicy, and it was plenty of food without being too huge. And the service was friendly and quick. I'm definitely very glad I stopped in to check it out.
author: Jamon B.

description: yummy little morsels of heaven.  Make sure you add to what ever taco you order quac and cheese!!!!
author: christyna c.

description: Thank you, Tacobar, for saving my bladder.  The door with a huge hand and the words EL BANO painted on it are very visible from the street.  Of course, I feel obligated to purchase something, so had some carnitas tacos and a glass of sangria.  Sister had nachos.  Food was fresh, awesome chips for the nachos, sweet sangria (although I would of preferred it a bit on the cooler side), and a EXCEPTIONALLY clean bathroom.
author: Nicole G.

description: This place does the San Felipe fish taco PROPER: super crispy fish, and an excellent variation on the white sauce.   If you order the carne asada tacos I recommend getting the beans on the side.
author: Kevin E.

description: Over-priced mediocre food that is drenched in too much lime and takes too long to arrive. But the rude service was the worst. As I sat at a 2-person table while my husband stood a long time in a short line to order, I was asked THREE times whether I was ordering food, each time with major attitude, as in, the 3 different people who asked me then went behind the counter, pointed at me, and discussed me. I was not drunk, I was showered and wearing clean clothes, but I was treated as if I'd staggered in wearing a Hefty bag and barfed on their floor. Way to drive away customers. We will not be back.
author: Laura R.

description: no prices listed on the menu board !?!?! what kind of method of operation is this?? the tacos are 5-6$ and not any bigger then the 2.50$ tacos in the mission .. fail
author: Micah W.

description: Food is good, but WAY overpriced for what you get. Nick's Crispy Taco's and Tacolicious are much better for the price. The tacos were good though, not great. Had the mahi mahi, carnitas and carne asada. All average, chips and salsa were good. If you're hungry and in the area, it's fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.
author: mehul p.

description:
Taco Bar is just OK.  They make you pay for chips and salsa which I don't like.

Not a ton of vegetarian choices.

Prices are average/little pricey in my opinion.  Veggie burritos are like 8 bucks (and then you have to pay for chips/salsa).
author: Anna O.

description: Guacamole and home made chips were excellent. I had a shrimp quesadilla that was excellent while the others in my party had either chicken or fish tacos.  Great place to get a quick bite and people watch!
author: P G.

description: There is no excuse charging almost $6 for a taco that was not even that flavorful.  Their portions are large but this is because they stuff their tacos with shredded cabbage. Seating sucks in there, too. No, I will not be back.
author: Chris D.

description: I gotta say, Mexican food should not be this expensive.  I know it's on Fillmore and all, but 3.50 for a taco?  Get outta here!  You have to pay for chips and salsa (ridiculous), and their margaritas are TINY.  It get's 2 stars because the food is actually pretty decent, but you're gonna pay for it.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Food was a bit bland but edible and seemed like ok quality and clean, service was fast and friendly. Prices...well, the prices are way too high for Mexican food that you have to wait in line to order...$11 for a burrito and a can of diet coke (no glass, no ice, no lemon) with no cheese, no sour cream and no guacamole and no chips offered as a side? And it is really not that big either...I ate half and saved the rest not because I was full but because I had to go to a yoga class in 2 hours and didnt want stomach issues during class.  Admittedly it is much better than La Salsa which used to be in this space but you can pretty much scrape the bottom of your fridge and find something tastier than you would get at La Salsa so that is not too much of a compliment. 
The salsas are tasty and very salty...but the burrito really needed to be drowned in the salsas provided because there was a distinct lack of flavor. 
All that being said, I might come back here eventually since this is Fillmore street and there is no good food on this damn street!
author: Nilu r.

description: Great location, fresh organic beef and other meats, but I hate to say it but food is not that tasty.  Bring your own homemade salsa to give the food, like their burritos, some flavor.  At most the food is very very bland and over priced. Salsa is not great either.  Food is far from authentic tasting Mexican food other than menu names of the food items.   I wish the food was more tasty and authentic since its in my neighborhood.  You can get a better tasting, more authentic burrito or taco elsewhere in the City - and at a better price too!
author: Paul C.

description: I've tried a few things on the menu, and I think I would have enjoyed them more if the flavor didn't have to fight through the overwhelming saltiness. The quesadilla was a little greasy. The prices are a little high, but the service was good.
author: T _.

description:
Ok, I like that they serve free-range chicken, angus beef, natural pork, fresh line caught fish BUT, yes, here's a huge BUT, was it really worth the high price you're paying them? I don't get why they're so busy. I really don't. We ordered the chicken taco and steak taco and yes, they were good but for $4 each?! That's loco! In Oakland, I like getting the $1.25 tacos which you can basically get anywhere AND they're the exact same size but with more meat! Yes, they're very nice and helpful here (except for the female cashier who was only mediocre in her greeting me and taking my order) but is that enough for me to come here? Nope. So, I got 2 tacos for $8 and needless to say, I was still starving. Should I have splurged and got another? No, I'd rather drive home to the east bay and purchase 8 carne asada tacos, pollo de rez and a huge horchata for $20 AND it includes chips and fresh salsa. Going here sure didn't appease my appetite and needless to say, I went to my favorite taco restaurant in Oakland - Tacos El Grullo. I went there last night actually. ;) 

So, what I'm saying is, we spent $18 on 2 tacos and 1 burrito (no drinks, no extras, no cheese, no sour cream, etc.) and no, it wasn't worth it. Save your money and spend it in Oakland.
author: Mayana P.

description: It is a good place and they can be fast. I have had a few orders mixed up but they have always figured it out. Things are salty at times and I would like less. No other fast mex in the area. So happy they are here
author: Lisa B.

description:
easily six stars.

loved this place!  super unique plants, and lighting fixtures.  i learned spanish on cute flip cards at the bar while waiting for my order.  they reuse their knives, spoons, and forks.  the seating had Color and cushiony-ness without being tasteless or nose up in the air.  got my dinner there at 6:30p tonight and the setting sun caught the transparent green on the windows there and made the place GLOW. that vibrant color.  

overhead lighting chandelier style, all clear glass, some were beakers with stoppers, filled with water that vibrated whenever a heavy car rolled by, pretty incredible when there is noticeable movement in a lighting fixture, and it all blended together very well.  i just couldn't take my eye off the place.  taco bar? more like genius bar. sorry Apple, this place has left you in the dust.

a little black bird politely walked in looking for food scraps.  my neighbor offered burrito skin and i dropped a piece of corn.

whoever put their touches on the place has effortless TASTE.  and not in the controlled way that some places have, but very casual and friendly type of way.  usually people wouldn't get away with those bright colors but this place DOES.  

incredible taste in environment AND food.

the taco: wondering where the cheese was, and realized it was the smaller orange shell hugging the taco shell!  still tasted incredible.

they had watermelon fresca to drink (i love watermelon props tacobar!) and even more props for not turning the drink into a candy bar and letting the natural juices quench peoples' thirst from the food

they had an awesome corn side, that came with cream and some type of red pepper powder that made it taste incredible.  

just really awesome and uniquely tasty options here that i haven't seen anywhere else.

i'd like to be invited to this person's home.
author: Samantha W.

description:
Looking for casual Mexican food?  Looking for something fresh and less formulaic than "Baja Fresh Mex" or "Chipotle?"  Then you best stroll down the hill to "Tacolicious" or newly opened "Tacko," just down the street. 

I'm certainly open to different styles/approaches to Mexican cuisine but just can't tolerate tiny salsa containers, slow service, incorrect orders, and mediocre food.  I know food prices are soaring but I can't imagine offering lilliputian salsa portions on 'to go' orders is really improving the bottom line.  That said, they do offer ample (albeit limited selection) salsa if you choose to dine in.  However, the last time I checked in (to give this place a 3rd chance) the place was empty so it would seem few folks are taking advantage of the 'dine in experience.'  

The final reason this place is stuck at 2 stars vs. 3 is price.  After tax, you are facing nearly $10 for a chicken burrito with guac that's wrapped in foil.  Really? $10 for a smallish chicken burrito?   

Frankly, I'm looking forward to the next restaurant that will likely take this prime location in the near future.
author: Joe S.

description:
On the whole I think that TacoBar has been a good addition to Fillmore.  It's not really fair to compare this place pricewise to taquerias in the Mission or elsewhere -- the rent that they're paying must be exorbitant, so the prices are going to be higher, and they do serve organic food.  

The food is almost always good -- I did have one bad experience here in the past, but the owner was pretty responsive. 

Service probably could be a bit more careful.  They get orders wrong pretty frequently, but otherwise everyone's friendly.
author: D L.

description: BORING. Over salted, bland, and too expensive for the portions you get.  Not worth the puffy eyes and unsatisfied craving for mexican food.
author: Honest Y.

description: Best pescado taco in town.  No one compares.  (I admit I haven't tried anything else)
author: Christin A.

description:
3 stars really only because of the price. I mean, okay it's located on Filmore but still...don't call yourself a Taco Bar and charge $4+ for ONE taco and a burrito for almost $8!! That's absurd.

Granted the tacos are of decent size, I think I could eat two easily but then that's almost $10 for two tacos. No thanks. I had gotten a carne asada taco which was decent. There was a lot of meat but...that's pretty much it. Just meat, salsa, and tortilla. Boring. You would have to order chips and guac separately. 

Meh I'd say go elsewhere. We only stopped in because neither of us had tried it and decided to give it a go. I'll end this review on a positive though...it's definitely clean and nice to eat in. Haha. Service is pretty quick.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Let me start by saying that I just had a taco for dinner and it cost $7, WTF?

Let me add that this taco was not really good, WTF?

TacoBar has three fundamental  problems:

1) Most importantly the namesake tacos are all filler and no killer.

Yes they are on the large side, but for the price I'd bloody well hope so. But the large scoop of beans and bland meat that make up the bulk of the taco are not very pallitable, the lackluster salsas do little to help the situation.

2) The prices, way too high.

A taco for $7, $8 for a fish taco, is insane. Granted this includes the additional price incurred ($1.95) to make our taco "especial". Especial at TacoBar means your taco comes with Guacamole and Chorizo Cheese. Sounds good, how could chorizo cheese be bad? Well it is, the guacamole is all right , but the cheese is almost as disappointing as the meal as a whole. Its basically like a Parmesan crisp, cheese fried with a little chorizo into a flattened disc. A great garnish idea,but not something you want to eat a bunch of. They make it into a disc the size of a tortilla and than sandwich it between your two tortillas. The idea i guess is it would add a crunchy texture and some cheesy flavor, but when you fry cheese and flatten it down all the flavor leaks out and your left with a tasteless disc of cheese with a texture similar to soft plastic. A scoop of guacamole and plastic cheese for $1.95, no thanks. Not that eliminating it will help your bottom line, the tacos by themselves are all around $5.

3) the place and the food is cumbersome and awkward. 

The tacos are almost too big too handle or bite, and too awkwardly constructed to lie flat and go at with a fork and knife. The jicama salad is made up of thick coins of jicama and accompanied by smashed grapefruit, barely reconizeable as the pretty fruit that it is. Than there is the space, small and cramped the space is made smaller by the fact that the owner/manager has made one of  the few stools his office. Add to this that the hostess/waitress/owner women is walking about spreading cold vibes and even colder stares and you have yourself TacoBar.

Seriously TacoBar, WTF.
author: Alex D.

description:
(keep in mind i only tried the tacos)
after wanting to try this place out for  while, i decided to go today, and i must say my  this is hands down the worst "taco" i have had in sf.
To start off, the people were less then friendly, not one smile and all looked like they hated there life.
second if your "especial taco" it will cost you 5 dollars and the portion of the "special" part is barbie sized.
 your shop is named taco bar, make the darn tacos right. sprinkling the taco with guacamole is not worth the 1.95 extra /9honestly i was wonder how i was going to split the portion on two tortillas). And to top it off no tortilla chips, the only good point was the bathroom .
author: lisa v.

description: I'm surprised how low the reviews for this place are! I was out to Happy Hour with a girlfriend a few days ago, me being a Mission resident and she a Pac Heights girl, and somehow we broached the subject of burritos. I am a waste of a Mission resident because I really don't like burritos. As a vegetarian traditional Mexican places just slop beans on and stuff it with rice, guac, and some tomatoes and lettuce if you're lucky. This means the texture is basically mush and I really don't know why I'd blow so many calories on something so mediocre. After my manifesto, she said we had to go to TacoBar. 20 minutes later, at about 9:55pm, we arrive. The staff was obviously closing up shop but kind enough to serve us. I got the vegetarian burrito. It was SO good-- very California style burrito, with fresh veggies and a good mix of flavor and textures. The red chipotle salsa was awesome and this Mission girl will be heading to this Pac Heights location from now on for her burritos.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Yum!  The fancy front kept me at bay, and now that I have finally stopped in and quenched my thirst from awide selection of fresh aguas frescas and organic, authentic style tacos I am smitten!
author: Alison D.

description: Was not disappointed in the tacos themselves but was definitely not anything special.  Given all of the great spots in the neighborhood, wont be heading back for round 2 anytime soon
author: Brett J.

description: I ordered take-out last thursday night from TacoBar. I don't think I've ever tasted a more delicious taco than the two I ordered, one was a "Veracruz Pescado" with grilled Mahi-Mahi, and the other was "Baja Pescado" with Tempura beer battered Mahi-Mahi. Both were awesome, but I must say the "Baja" was OUTSTANDING!!!!!! My friend ordered the Carne Asada Quesadilla, and was very pleased. I couldn't believe how much beef was in it, and it was delicious. The Mexican Rice Pudding was also very tasty, with chopped Mango on top. This was my second time eating the food from TacoBar. Again, I highly reccommend this place for authentic Mexican cuisine, you will not regret it. Also, the service was outstanding, the girl that took the order on the phone, and the waiter who helped bag it, just overall ***** (five stars)!!!!!
author: Vince F.

description: Yum! Cute, simple, and welcoming, Tacobar was just what my friend and I were looking for as we strolled down Fillmore one evening. Flavorful, classic dishes made in an innovative fashion with yum drinks like agave pomegranate margaritas, horchata, and cucumber lime juice.
author: Lina L.

description: A neighborhood staple. Baja pescado burrito is the best one. Tacos are good. The rice, beans and cheese burrito is basic but is good. Nachos are great. But pass on the margaritas if you aren't into blended icy drinks. Service is fast and friendly, especially when you call ahead to order.
author: Melissa B.

description:
"How is everything?" asked the woman walking around who appeared to be the owner...

I wanted to tell her it was the worst meal I've paid for in months, and that I was disappointed that they could not have figured out how to sneak a peak of flavor into my bland dinner. Instead, I shrugged and said, "this cheese, its a bit...rubbery." To which she replied it was meant to be a cheese crisp. This is the cheese crisp I had paid $1.95 to have added to my fish taco that they had sandwiched between my two tortillas. Well, someone ought to educate the owner on what happens when you fry cheese. The oil comes out, the flavor leaves with it, and you are left with rubbery cheese that is neither palatable nor very digestible. A good garnish, yes, but give me some cotija, not this crappy cheese disc thing. The part that gets me the the most, though, is that if you are going to walk around asking your (clearly disappointed) patrons how their (clearly bland) meal is, then listen to them!! Don't you realize you are in the first few months of being open and that your diners may have some real feedback to help you improve and make me actually want to come back?! Listen to your paying customers, your neighbors, and your potential future return patrons.

Alex D. had the carnitas taco. He left at least 2/3 of it behind. His poor little tasteless, all-filler-no-killer, bland bean and tasteless salsa mess, was so bad he didn't want to waste precious tummy space on it.

My fish taco which I made Especial (read: NOT Especial at all) was a hot mess of bland, not crispy or fresh tasting fish, topped off with some more bland guacamole and crema. It was not easy to eat, nor good to eat. YUCK. And PLEASE tell me how you can possibly justify charging $1.95 to add a teaspoon of guac, a teaspoon of crema, and crap plastic cheese to my already overpriced taco?! I'm not a cheap person, and I'll be the first to pay for quality, but this my friends was not quality at all.

The Jicama salad was a poor excuse for a salad. It was literally huge discs of jicama, combined with unrecognizable mashed tasteless grapefruit, cilantro, and peanuts - it was impossible to eat. At least julienne cut the freakin' jicama so your diner can eat your bad tasteless salad!

I just returned from Puerto Vallarta where I had amazing food, with tons of flavor. Maybe my taste buds are spoiled, but I think even someone who dines at Denny's would think TacoBar has forgotten their flavor in their food.

I've read that the owner here used to work with the guys from Nick's Crispy tacos. Save yourself from this mess of a taco shop and go to Nick's. I don't love that place either, but at least your won't feel ripped off by some bitchy owner at this new Pac Heights establishment and you can use your leftover cash to catch a cab to the Mission for some real flavor.

Never again.
author: Abby Z.

description:
Fresh - yest. Tasty - yes! Authentic - Yes! Expensive - Sad, but true.
As good as it gets within walking distance of Fillmore -- earns it all 5 stars.  Salad crisp/delicious. Vegetarian options yummy and filling. Burritos, tacos, quesadillas filled with flavor.  Have been nearly 10 times and service has been attentive, kind, and smiling each and every time.  Still developing some of their systems and I admire that they seek to improve.  We are going back . . . in 20 minutes.
author: Howard R.

description: More stylish and less chain-store than the La Salsa outpost it replaced (hardly a feat), TacoBar is sadly more expensive than its predecessor without a corresponding increase in meal quality. While it's great to see a cute joint on this busy corner, I could do with a Cal-Mex lunch that didn't cost me $15 - two tacos baja pescados + chips, no beverage. Chips were stale. Tacos were good.
author: West R.

description: We had a good experience here- fish tacos with guacamole and a tasty crispy cheese outer shell. Really liked the salsas that came with it. A little pricy for the size, but we had really good service and would come back.
author: Double-Dash C.

description: Good sangria, good chips.  Tacos are just eh. Better off going to the mission for mexican food. Oh decent sangria though - they put mangoes in it.
author: Tara H.

description:
If you are going to charge $5 for a taco it better taste like a $5 taco.

Suggestion: lower the price by a buck, make the taco smaller and tastier.

Oh yeah and I completely concur with the thought that others have voiced here that if you are going to charge that much for tacos, throw some bloody chips in for free.

I never thought I would write this but:

RIP La Salsa....you may have not been the best taco joint but what replaced it is more expensive and not as tasty!
author: Thomas S.

description: For a quick taco, this place is great!  I love the fish tacos!
author: Heda J.

description: I had the freshest carne asada burrito at this place. Tender steak and fresh pico. The two salsas on the side were difficult to decide which was better.  GREAT musica !  No waiter service but the cute girl with the pretty eyes walking around ready to help with anything you might need.  Thing is and I'm not complaining but the doors and windows wide open is fine if you are in Cabo but not at Filmore and California.  Almost went to the cafe next door for the coziness but opted for the Tacobar only because I pass this place all the time and had a chance to stop in.  Good choice !
author: Randy P.

description: I like TacoBar, about as much as I like my other SF favorite. Besides filling a sorely needed casual dinner/taco shop on Fillmore, the food here is pretty great. It's fresh and tasty and service has always been friendly. I typically order the fish tacos and nachos with carne asada. I think the nachos can be a bigger portion size, but it's sooooo good maybe I'm just greedy. The food is probably a bit more expensive than the stuff you get elsewhere, but it's in Pac Heights and I think the food is better than most places in the Mission (where some of the food can be a bit geasy). This is a good neighborhood spot, if you're in the area.  I'd like to deduct a half star to make this a 3.5 star review because of ONE THING: What's up with not listing the prices? I know maybe prices can change daily, but that really irks me. Consumers have the right to know what they're paying for and its embarrassing to ask the cashier how much each of your items cost.  Anyway, bf and I typically order two fish tacos, one meat taco, one order of nachos, and a hotchata for $26 for those of you who are wondering what a meal for two would cost.
author: Trinh N.

description:
get the Quesadilla ($7.50). it's not cheap but nothing on the menu really is. but this is at least good. filled with melty cheese, carne asada, and some other creamy tasty stuff, the whole thing is grilled to warm crispy perfection. much much preferable to my own burrito ($7.75) which was a bit lackluster - maybe because the spanish rice filled inside was the predominant flavor (or lack there of).

while called the taco bar, there weren't THAT many varieties of tacos. basically at about $4.75 (couldn't tell if that was for 1 or 2), you get traditional style small tortillas filled with a meat of your choice. you can add on "especiale" style for an extra $1.25 or $1.75 and get the extra toasty cheese crust. i tried it and didn't think it was worth it. kinda reminded me of hardened chewy microwaved cheese.

other key points: they close early (9p), they come and take away your food and trays even though you're not quite done, you order first and then find a table, there's free ice water by the door.

taco bar is no mission taqueria.
author: Cindy W.

description: UPDATE::  Still are too expensive.  Need to consider a name change say to Taco Boutique     ?
author: John C.

description: Great fish tacos but a bit on the pricey side.  They've got both deep fried and non-deep fried fish tacos.  I usually get both.  :)
author: Mark G.

description: it's kinda crazy. i went there for lunch with a lovely lady who just turned two. I ordered a casadilla to share and I ordered some guacamole and sour cream on the side in case my lil babe wasn't interested in those. After we received the food the server (who was also the cashier) told me that I have to pay her $1.50 for the extra stuff. I didn't have cash with me so she told me I should pay with my card after I finished my lunch. how gracious, isn't she? she made the mistake, not me!!! i was extremely pissed off! i even gave her a tip when i ordered the food, it would have covered the stupid guacamole. she should have waved the extra things since-yet again-it was her fault, she forgot to ring those up. anyways...the food is so-so, I have had better but the service was very disappointing.
author: Oyo S.

description: I was a little skeptical as soon as I saw "Burros" on the menu instead of "Burritos." (One of many ways in which this restaurant tries to stand apart from other Taquerias...) But my friend Jeff and I gave it a whirl anyway. We ended up with an order of Baja Fish Tacos with one tiny nugget of fried fish in each tortilla ($7), a Carnitas "burro" lacking flavor and 2 steak tacos "Especiales" with a bizarre fried cheese thing on the side and perhaps a teaspoon of guac on each. Why mess with a good thing, Tacobar? Take a cue from places like La Taqueria and our beloved taco trucks around SF... you've got work to do.
author: sian t.

description: this is very special mexican artisan natural and tasty cuisine.  It is not your ordinary run of the mill greasy spoon at all!!!  Their chicken and also the chips and guac are A rated.
author: Margo D.

description: Not that good. I had a grilled fish burrito for $9 and it didn't come close to any taqueria in the Mission. Fish was dry and not very tasty.
author: Zephan F.

description: I have to agree with most of the "Meh" reviews, too expensive, great location, interesting decor, average food. I have to add that the service is great and, since the place is relatively new, it can only get better from here!
author: Paolo D.

description: I've had the enselada avocado cesar and the burro camarones.  I really enjoy the salad, which has a generous amount of well-seasoned chicken, crispy lettuce and ripe avocado.  It's really good with a couple of generous splashes of the salsa verde.  The burro camarones, while it was yummy, had a lot of liquid in it and therefore it wasn't really possible to eat the last 1/5 or so of the burro because it simply falls apart into a heap of shredded cabbage and watery juice.  They should think about having rice instead of slaw and just dressing it with a nice mango salsa.  It would hold up better.  I like the people that run this place--they always make you feel like you are a very welcome customer and the service is awesome.  A tad on the pricey side, but I'm sure the cost of commercial leases on Fillmore force the prices up for the merchants.
author: Eve C.

description: 3 1/2 Stars. TacoBar has great burritos, super fresh guacamole and pico de gallo, and good beer. Some other reviewers have criticized it for being overpriced, and it does cost a little more than other taco joints that don't look quite as nice inside, but I had really, really good food here and I would go here again. You order at the counter and they bring it out to you, but there's still pleasant, speedy service. It's a very cool corner eatery.
author: Lowen B.

description: I gave it another shot yesterday and an additional star because I was fairly stuffed afterwards. Chicken burrito especial was around $11. Chicken, rice, and beans (which were undercooked) were hot. Sour cream and guac were cold. I can't stand this difference in temperatures (same reason I have problems with Chipotle). I agree with my friend Emily T. Walk off the extra calories by going to and from Burrito Express on Divis. I'll reserve Tacobar for moments of extreme hunger and losing bets.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Best corn on the cob ever.... Everything is fresh, great fish tacos. Great for on the go, however the in-house seating situation is awkward. Leave some extra time in case they're busy, service can be slow. If it's all about good food, here you have it.
author: J G M.

description:
I have given this place a fair shot... have been 4 or 5 times. I will say I'm happy that we know where the meat is coming from. Concept is good, atmosphere is cute but way too bright like a Johny Rocket's at midnight.   It's above the quality of La Tortilla or whatever it was before.  

BUT Tacobar....THIS place is incredibly overpriced, the service is poor...slow and not friendly...did I mention the awful fluorescent lighting? I have ordered in twice and to-go twice.  Waited WAY too  long for both services.  Once it was busy and I waited 20 mins for -to-go (they hadn't been open for long so I was patient).   The manager so nicely gave me some chips because he realized I had been there forever and got skipped in the line somehow.

So tonight, hopeful.... I go in and order a baja pescado burrito on the menu for $8.5. I add guacamole which I know is extra and ask to replace the cabbage with a small portion of rice/beans.....and she tells me the total is $14.  How do you go from $8.5 to $14 by swapping out a few mexican ingredients!   I hadn't ordered anything else! Mind you this includes ZERO CHIPS.  Not even a handful on top of the bag. ZERO.  And you get 2 tablespoons of red and green salsa.   SERIOUSLY?!  The food is decent but it's nothing to brag to your friends about.  Besides, the pricing and service bring the quality of the food down.  It just does. 

We all know there is better Mexican in the mission and then there is the AMAZING Little Chihuahua...which is a similar concept of using local organic ingredients and natural meat.  At Little Chihuahua you get all the chips you want and there is self service to about half a dozen salsas that are delicious.  And Little Chihuahua is on there second store and they are reasonably priced.  SO TACOBAR....rethink your business model, your customer service, your prices and try again.  You aren't doing it right and your reviews are NOT positive. 

Little Chihuahua..YOU ARE THE BEST AND SEE YOU SOON.
author: Allyson H.

description: Loved the shrimp quesadilla.. Nice and crispy flour tortilla large shrimp just enough spice to it and not too cheesy.. The cucumber and lime agua fresca was delicious..
author: marta o.

description: Bay to Breakers 2010. Drop into TacoBar as the other places were swarming with 'leftovers" from that day's event. Was skeptical as I am a big fan of taco trucks like El Tonayense so why a TacoBar. Well 2 things- fish tacos and fish burritos! The fish in both tacos and burritos are line-caught mahi-mahi and not farm-raised tilapia or cod. AND they are great tasting and filling! Oh and don't forget the orchata (not sure I got the spelling right)! We will be back for more.
author: Daryl C.

description: I had the carne asada one afternoon about a week ago.  It reminded me of Nick's Crispy Tacos, except it hurt my wallet a little more (I only go to Nick's for taco Tuesdays--side note:Tacobar, it would be awesome if you did cheap taco night).  The taco was good, but it's not something I would spend my day thinking about or ever have a craving for.  But since the place is close to my house, I'll probably be back.
author: Nita K.

description:
Continues to impress - the recent taco specials (duck confit, Yucatan pulled pork) were outstanding.

By no means the cheapest taco place in the city - but  considering the baseline in the Upper Fillmore, prices are very reasonable
author: Paul W.

description: Being from the home of the cheap burrito and just Mexican food in general, San Diego, I really don't want to like this place. I paid $10 for a quesadilla, which was tasty, but I just can't get over the price.  There was a handful of other things that I wanted to order, like the Mexican coke, and a side of chips, but I didn't want to have a $20 lunch without the waitstaff.  The location is great, and I'm sure they will get plenty of business for the folks that don't want to venture to the mission because it's a bit too authentic.  While I really enjoyed the quesadilla, I don't see myself stopping here often for lunch. Oh, I forgot to mention the staff was great, extremely friendly.
author: David M.

description: They lowered the prices and have definitely listened to the negative reviews regarding bland flavors, had a carne asada taco that was delicious and the portion was generous.
author: Wendy W.

description: I went in yesterday for some dinner and i love this place! I ordered the tortilla soup which was recommended to me by the owner/waitress who is super nice and so friendly and i was in heaven! it was the perfect way to warm up since the fog rolled right!  the soup was so tasty and filling! i have also tried their tacos and they are delish, crispy and tasty! yum! i also really like the atmosphere, it is very happy and the music is great, makes me want to go dancing! i will definately continue going back!
author: Maria C.

description: Good food for a taqueria. Especially the carneasada quesadilla especial. A little pricey, but hey, it's Fillmore.
author: Nima A.

description: The food is fresh,  but its bland and overpriced.  $12 for an iced tea and a poorly dressed Cesar salad with (literally) only 1.5 oz. of chicken, served on the side, in a catsup cup? Overpriced and mediocre food.
author: Brian D.

description: Finally, a great Mexican cafe in the neighborhood.  No it is not Mission Street cheap but you get what you pay for... simply QUALITY and TASTE!  The Chipotle Guacamole was absolutely delicious and the Pico de Gallo, I could have easily consumed buckets had my trousers had more Lycra.  My friend loved her chicken tacos and said the chicken was moist and flavorful, and the tortillas were perfectly prepared.  The wall menu is easy to read and all the prices displayed.  The only problem was deciding on what to eat.  We arrived at noon and everything looked appealing as we observed all the patrons devouring their meals with contented expressions.
author: Lauren L.

description:
For those people complaining about the price, I'd love to know where you usually go?!  Tacobar uses organic, fresh ingredients, and therefore will cost more than a Happy meal!
The several times I've been here the food tastes fresh, authentic and delicious.  Although the food is simple and no- frills, it has been far from bland to me.
I look forward to going back!
author: Lizzy C.

description: Good food, but $11 for a burrito and chips cost extra?  You can get the same thing, if not better so many other places.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I can't speak to the meat tacos, but the veggie stuff is pretty good.  I'm really picky about chips, and these were great chips.  They're actual tortillas cut up and fried (what is it with taquerias in the Mission handing out stale Doritos???) and then they sprinkle them with Cotija cheese, which almost makes up for the fact that you have to purchase them.  I couldn't taste anything in the veggie burrito except guac - and I don't love guac - so I was unthrilled about the burrito.  

But the tacos...  The menu says the veggie tacos have beans, pico de gallo, guac, and melted cheese.  But it's not melted cheese - it's GRILLED cheese.  On the OUTSIDE of the tortilla.  And I LOVE it.  I see cravings for these in my future - next time will skip the burrito and go right to the good stuff.
author: K K.

description: I went here when it first opened, I had no real positive or negative memories of the place, but had not been in in a few years. So  I though I'd give it another try.  I have been there 2x in the past 3 weeks. The first time was not a very good experience, the second time I had a similar experience but even worse. I ordered two simple chicken tacos and somehow they managed to screw it up both times. After I ordered and they brought the tacos to me, I immediately tried to eat the 1st one and it was so soggy it completely fell apart, before I took the first bite!. Needless to say the second was virtually dissolved when I tried it. The taco was horrible. This place is so cheap they smother their tacos with cheap beans. I picked through the horrible beans and only ate the chicken portion(not too bad). My plate looked like a disaster zone. This all transpired with in about 2 minutes. I then took the leftover crap and brought it to the manager and asked how they could serve this as food to people. Later I spoke with a friend who is knowledgeable/ in the restaurant business. He told me he had the same experience  there with a more expensive taco (carne ansada with guacamole). It is hard to believe that food like this is allowed to be served, especially with the volumes of wonderful and inexpensive Mexican restaurants all over and readily available.
author: Kat H.

description:
Are there only 5 stars? The cuisine at Taco Bar is fantastico!
The owner, Jack, is gracious, talented, and a super manager.
The food is fabulous, full of flavor and so fresh.  The Aguas Frescas are splendid!  And the soup!  Delicious!  The baja fish tacos melt in your mouth.  The salads are so appealing and so good to eat.  The quesa dias .. splendido! Even the plating of the burros is artistic.  The artistry and talent of Jack permiates every single item.  Run to try this glorious new addition to the Fillmore corridor.  You will be very glad you did!  We need more stars for this fun, fresh, and fantastic Taco Bar!!!  yum yum yum.
author: Patty L.

description: I ordered the fish burrito...it was kind of dry and not very flavorful. Way too much cabbage and not enough taste. Bummer, I was looking forward to a good burrito place on Fillmore :(
author: Caley Alyssa Y.

description:
My lady and I live 2 doors from tacobar and were excited for it to open, however our initial experience was less than impressive.  I wish these guys the best but they need to iron out some kinks.  

We ordered four tacos (with no guac, sour cream or cheese) chips and salsa and two cokes and paid close to $35.  The time from order to delivery was almost 20 minutes.  The manager did give us some extra chips and two orders of flan, but the damage had been done.  The fish tacos were great, but the carne asada didn't have much flavor.  

I hope they find a way to drop the prices a bit, offer free chips like any place in the mission, or speed up their delivery.  We would like to go back since its so close, but don't want to spend close to $50 for a quick mexican lunch.
author: Willy C.

description:
Friday, April 16, 2010

I've seen this space go from Rolling Pin Donuts (open 24 hours) to the now open Taco Bar.

I understand they have just opened and have a lot of issues to work out.  They indicate so on several signs posted around the exterior windows.  However, if they are planning on charging the type of prices their asking for, they better up their game!  For now, I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.

Service:  Fast, friendly and sufficient. No problems there.

Food:  I had the pollo burro with the taco bar "especial" and had asked for chips and salsa to go.  No drinks, desserts, etc.  The total was over 13.00!  I'm thought, WTF! While they were processing my debit card, I realized that they were charging for the chips!!!  I inquired as to whether or not this was true and was told this was indeed the case.  I cancelled the chips and continued to order my burro. The burro was OK, but I've had much better for much less!  In fact, the lack of chicken was ridiculous!  If I'm paying 10 plus bucks for a burrito, I expect to see some MEAT, whether it is steak, chicken, or pork. That said the ingredients I did taste were fresh and flavorful.  It was just totally lacking in MEAT!

Décor:  I love that they have provided bins for trash, recycling, and compost.  I also love the ice water jug!  I don't like the "corn field" window wraps.  I have two dogs (who I would kill for) that I like to keep a very close eye on while ordering and waiting for my neighborhood to go orders.  This "corn themed" window covering makes that next to impossible.  Also, if I were dining in, I would prefer to see the action outside on Fillmore and California, not the "corn field" window wrap.

Recap:  I'll let them work the minor issues out and will try them again, but if they think I'm going to pay 10 plus bucks for a burrito with little to no MEAT, they are out of their minds!
author: Doug C.

description: Great during my 1st 2 visits but my carnitas taco on my 3rd visit was terrible.  The meat literally tasted and felt like wet paper towels - and I mean "literally" in the literal sense of the word.  Guacamole on the 3rd visit was also WAY over-salted.  I was excited to have them in the neighborhood after the 1st two visits but now I'm afraid I will have to ask them to leave.  Goodbye.
author: Oscar M.

description: This was our pre-movie dinner and I was excited to check this place out.  The staff was nice and the atmosphere was cute.  That's pretty much all this place has going for them though.  I ordered the chicken burrito and my boyfriend ordered a fish taco.  The chicken burrito tasted okay, but nothing out of the ordinary.  My poor boyfriend suffered from starvation, as his taco had a tiny piece of fish and was mostly filled with cabbage.  For the price, the taco was a total rip-off!  He was pretty disgusted and I was disappointed.  Oh well, this place will be gone soon, but at least I still have my favorite burrito places around.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Man, this place makes me so sad.  NO FLAVOR AT ALL!!!  It's as if they dumbed down what mexican food should taste like for the neighborhood.  But come on, why skip the cilantro, onions, spices, flavor?  BLAND BLAND BLAND.  Two stars for the fact that the chicken itself was soft and tender.  But even the sauces that come on the table can't save this place.  Sure, the staff is really nice, but unless this place can take these consistently negative reviews and shape up, I can't see how it will survive.  (Oh wait, looks like some people like this flavorless sort of food.  Lucky for them.)
author: Isabel M.

description: Loved it!!! Hubby got the carne asada and I carnitas quesadilla.  Yes, it's small, yes you are lucky to get a table.  But the food is delicious and worth the seating hassle.  Loved the tender fresh not old tortillas. And our quesadilla was more like a half burrito - so we were full!!
author: Karen H.

description:
Well, it doesn't suck. I guess when you have a place as well designed and trendy looking, it kind of raises your expectations. So with that in mind we were mostly disappointed in our food.
We ordered 4 facos; baja fish, fish varacruz, carne asada and carnitas. The tacos look really impressive. They are mini cornucopias of lettuce and filling. The baja fish taco was by far the best with a tangy dressing  and fried fish. It's a no-brainer. The veracruz was a little anemic on the fish and the veracruz sauce tasted like canned tomatoes. The carne asada was tender but had no real flavor. Carnitas tasted boiled and bland. The pinto beans in the meat tacos had no flavor and the meat tacos were topped with plain chopped tomatoes. Not even pico de gallo. I understand that Mexican food doesn't have to be super spicy to be good, but a little cilantro, onion, herbs, anything. 
The only salsas are two squirt bottles on each table. The red salsa has a smoky, roasted flavor. The green one tastes like cactus/nopales. Pretty good, but if you want spice neither of those will satisfy you.
No complimentary chips. It is expensive.
Ice cream flavors look intriguing. 
Still left yearning for a solid Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood. 
I don't think I will go back. Though I am curious to try their burrito. They looked really sad and I am wondering if they could be as bad as they look. I guess it's a lose/lose bet with myself.
author: Camila F.

description: Had 2 tacos, one fish taco veracruz and one carne asada. The fish taco veracruz was extremely fishy tasting. like they gave me all the dark meat near the skin that had been sitting in the freezer for years. The cabbage slaw and salsa on top were probably pretty decent, but I couldn't really taste them on account of all that fishy-ness. The carne asada was decent. no complaints there. But seriously, don't advertise fresh line-caught fish if its been sitting in a freezer since 1997.
author: Catherine M.

description:
I like this place. Sure LaSalsa was cheap and edible but this place, in my opinion, is much better. Yeah it's more expensive but the quality of the food is better. Everything is organic. If you eat here, there's decent table service. 

I think most of the people complaining are thinking cheap, who cares where the meat and fish come from, fast food when they walk in here. It is fast but at a higher quality. Lot's of people complain about the cheese on the taco. Ask them to leave it off. Actually I never noticed it.

All in all. I think the place rocks. Yeah it's a couple of bucks more than you're typical taqueria but I think the food is closer to what you get at a sit down restaurant. And I've been to many where I think the food blows.

Plus the owner is really cool. His name is Jack, you can't miss him. Tell him what you think, good or bad. He really wants to make this place the best it can be. Leave a review here but tell him as well so he can do something.
author: Ty H.

description:
$12 for a burrito, that is just insane!

Fish burrito with no rice or salsa included.  Just coleslaw, fish, guac and sour cream.  Not too big, not too small, took 10 minutes to get the burrito.  Only reason I give it 2 stars is the phenomenal location and the comfy pillowed seats inside.  Not worth it!
author: Aron M.

description:
I don't get it.  I see so many reviews describing bland food.  If you want cheese soaked boiled beans, then go to a typical mex spot like gordos (no offense).  Tacobar is not for you.  Tacobar offers amazing low fat tasty dishes that are fantastic and a true breath of fresh air.

But again, if you want a 3,000 kcal fat ass bomb, this is not your spot, although they do offer to make anything special with more cheese and sour cream.
author: Jerome B.

description:
I've eaten here a few times and must say that it keeps getting better.  I've finally settled on the Carne Asada Burro (ito) and make it Especial.  It's not spicy and not over stuffed with rice like Gordos.  If you want spice use 1 of the 2 sauces they place at your table.

Service has gotten REALLY fast.  I barely got settled and my burro was at my table.  The wait staff is on top of it.  Keeping it clean. Nice!
If restrooms make the difference then this one is worth a try. Clean, clean, clean.
author: Ken C.

description: What a disappointment. I've been there 3 times now and each time I'm more let down than the last.  Completely over-priced crappy Mexican food, and calling it Mexican is a disgrace to the cuisine.  I just paid almost $8 for a cheese quesadilla & the cheese wasn't even melted thru. All my meals have been completely lacking flavor and soul.  C'mon Tacobar, get it together!
author: Angela O.

description: The food was delicious. Because of the crowd, we had to wait a bit. But definitely worth it. Service was friendly.  Fabulous ambience. I won't have to drive to the Mission. I have my taco place in my hood now.
author: Isabella L.

description:
Just tried out Tacobar for the first time. Ordered a chicken taco to test out the place and was glad I only ordered 1. I did find the ingredients to be very fresh, but the tortilla and packaging choice was the loser. It was extremely hard to eat and I ended up eating most of it off of my plate. For $5 a taco, you better impress the crap outta me. 

A for ingredients
F for execution
F- for price

I give this place 3 months.
author: Scott D.

description:
Here is the deal with TacoBar.... If u open a restaurant in SF you better have great, creative food...a great ambiance...and a great staff ...most all restaurants here charge a premium for the food, so those three variables better be there.
So much hype surrounded this place when it opened... I guess I was expecting a real gourmet type Mexican food place...Instead, its just a really expensive taqueria. (good food, ok ambiance and suspect staff).
author: Tom E.

description:
My $7 "Baja" fish taco was smothered in what appeared to be a glop of canned Tartar sauce, bringing it down to the level of some kind of wanna-be Mexican Gordon's fish stick. 

Everything was over-salted. 

The chips were good, but, really, how can you go wrong with those?
author: Kate R.

description: I would go with 2.5.  Nothing wrong with the food, but as others have noted it seems overpriced - however with a great location (and most likely absurd rent) and apparently continuous line, do not see any logic in lowering prices.  Carnitas were dry, salsa selection limited.  La Salsa was a great service to the neighborhhod.
author: Glenn S.

description: too pricey..i had a fish burrito and soda for $13..and if  you want chips on the side you gotta pay extra...the slaw in the burrito kinda spicy....your better off in the mission if you want a real burrito....
author: Manolo V.

description:
I was so excited for this place to open! I love mexican food! I ordered a carnitas taco (hold the beans). This tiny little taco had no flavor and consisted of carnitas (very dry), salsa, and a tortilla. With tax this was a little more than $5. ;( I am so sad cuz I really wanted to like this place! I will still have to go all the way to the mission for a good taco! 

BTW- A basket of chips is $3.20. I would pay $1-$2 cuz I understand they don't want people just coming in and eating chips and salsa, but $3.20 is crazy! 

I live in the neighborhod, so I will go back a couple more times to give them some time to change. I will update this review if things get better...or worse?!
author: jane s.
