description: The jicama salad was sprinkled with a very minimal amount of grapefruit membrane that didn't add up to one-half of a single grapefruit segment and wasn't worth the hefty $8 plus price.
author: M. B.

description: We stopped here to grab an early dinner before a class we were headed to up the street.  Let me start by saying I'm a big fan of "tex-mex" or "cali-mex" type places.  My husband I both got carnitas burritos "especial" and they were really good.  Very fresh, tasty ingredients.  The carnitas were not fatty or greasy and the salsas and such were fresh.  I couldn't finish my burrito, but my husband ate his and the rest of mine (I read some reviews regarding the "small" portions so I'm trying to help put it in perspective).  The guacamole and chips were also really good!  Yum, I'd definitely go back for a burrito fix.
author: Gina R.

description: Signed up for yelp just to drop this line.  Not a good taco, overpriced, fish gone in one bite, overpriced.  Not sure how they can stay in business.
author: Michael K.

description: Their food is overly salty to the point of being un-edible. They tell you they have refried beans but they're not. They're full beans they slightly press a spoon over. When you tell them that you were expected refried beans, they say they don't do typical refried beans and they keep the bean whole then don't call it refried beans or it's misleading. Also, to charge $10-11 for an overly salty un-edible plate is simply incompetence of basic cooking. Good news is a homeless guy on the street benefited of the burrito bec I couldn;t eat if at 9pm exhausted from work and starving and didn't want to explain myself a second time after my first refried beans visit was a hassle. I did give it a second try and no more. I'm surprised they're in business bec most people I know say the same thing about this place. It has potential if they fix their salt intake and clarity in preparation. Lastly, their burrito's are dry, another thing to improve.
author: Emmanuella A.

description: A good tasting burrito that was ridiculously overpriced. About $11 bucks (including tax) for a special chicken burrito that is average sized (without chips/drink)? Lousy.
author: A I.

description:
This is more of a two an a half star review..

I'd been eyeing this place for a while since I find myself walking by it a lot. Today I got a chicken burrito "especial". It was $10.53 including tax and was thoroughly underwhelming for the amount of money I spent. The chicken in it was really good, but so good in a way that it made me realize how everything else in the burrito was just average. The tortilla had little flavori, rice was kind of overcooked, beans were beans and probably from a can and not homemade, pico was made with somewhat questionable tomatoes, sour cream was abundant in a way that was kind of gross, cheese was definitely not melted as described on the menu and the guacamole was pretty good. It came with a smokey red salsa and a salsa verde in tiny cups, but I'm not really into smokey/chipotle flavors or tomatillos so I passed. My biggest problem was that the burrito cost me nearly $11 and wasn't served with chips. WTF. 7 or 8 chips would have made everything a bit better and they for sure would not be getting a 2-star review. 

This place for sure caters to the yuppy Fillmore crowd and has a monopoly on Mexican food on the street. It's great that they use quality meats/fish but it was quite clear that the tomatoes used in the pico were pumped full of god knows what chemicals. I will, however, be back at some point to try their fish tacos and purchase a basket of chips because fish tacos rule and I don't wanna hate on this place too much without trying their namesake.
author: Cathleen M.

description: Overpriced burritos.  19.00 for two childrens bean burritos. Bottle of water and a side of Guac.  Nice service, but nothing to write home about.
author: J F.

description: great breakfast!  and quesadilla!  I love it.  Little on the pricey side for Mexican but its close so I do not mind paying the premium.
author: Natalie E.

description: I come often.  Service is quick, everything is extra so can be a little pricey.  Salads, burrito's all yummy.
author: On C.

description: Yummm!  Fresh ingredients mixed with a modern fun cafe style restaurant makes this place enjoyable for lunch. The staff is super friendly too! My friend and I were greeted with a smile and an eagerness to place our order and make sure we got exactly what we wanted. Their wall menu is not updated, so be sure to use their paper take-out menus located at the cash register. Supposedly the owner is going to be changing the wall menu soon, but there is no E.T.A. on when that will occur. After deliberation, I decided upon the Chicken burrito for $7.75 and it comes with mexican rice, black/pinto beans, and tomato salsa. I asked for extra rice and got it no problems and no extra charge either. For drink I decided to try their raspberry puree fresca which is raspberry puree mixed with soda water and ice. Yummmm! Chips and salsa are sold separate and that costs around $2.75. Cheese on the chips are available at your request. Overall very satisfied with the meal! The burrito is huge and delicious and the tomato salsa is delicious and fresh. Love it!
author: Lauren S.

description: How can you ruin a bean and cheese burrito?  It tasted like cardboard.
author: Alison T.

description: We have been waiting for this place to open ever since La Salsa closed.  I got the chicken taco (tacobar Especial).  I loved the crispy cheese on the inside, and they loaded on the guac.  My boyfriend got the carnitas burrito and also enjoyed it.  The downside was the price.  The chips were extra...and not worth it.  I would definitely return for the delicious taco and burrito, but skip the stale chips.
author: Erica W.

description: While it is good to have a taqueria in Pac Heights, the food is extraordinarily ordinary. Add in the premium pricing and it's not really much to brag about. The ingredients are fine, but, for example, I had the tacos and 1) they don't let you mix meats (e.g. 1 pollo & 1 carne) and 2) they don't have a salsa bar. Major demerits.
author: Ricki M.

description: I totally disagree with the "good for kids" rating unless you're grabbing a taco to go. Limited seating & all high counters. I really wanted this place to be amazing and it fell short all around.
author: S S.

description: I played hooky from work one afternoon and met my partner in fillmore to pick-up a gift and grab some food. Like most here, I was a bit hesitant to eat at Taco Bar, thinking it might be like most Wannabe Taco places outside the Mission FLAVORLESS AND BLAND. I decided to stay clear of the tacos because I'm a bit spoiled by the Taco Truck near my job. So, I decided to go with the Carnitas Quesadilla.  To my surprise, It was really good. Primarily because of the Fresh Ingredients. You could truly tell the difference. I would have preferred a bit more heat. but the salsa wasn't bad. You also have to pay extra for things that should come with it automatically. My partner however, had the Taco. He said it was pretty good but, not enough food for him. He was envious of my Quesadilla. He had to order another  Taco to get full. We paid $30 for our meal which was over priced for Two Tacos, One Quesadilla and two beers. But, its is Pac Hts right? I would recommend  Taco Bar if you are hungry, want good fresh ingredients, and not on a budget! I would definetly get the Quesadilla again....Yummy...
author: Shelby D.

description: The thing I like about Taco Bar... their green salsa & chips.  Taco Bar is just ok, but pretty pricy for being ok.  I got a veggie burrito that had a couple added ingredients that were not on the menu under that burrito and my friend had a fish burrito that he ended up throwing away.  There was like a tiny tiny amount of fish in the thing and it was like $13-$14!!!! CRAZY!  I have given this place a couple of chances but  if I go back it will be to enjoy some chips and yummy green salsa and that is it! :(
author: Penn M.

description: I'm surprised to see so many bad reviews. I think the food here is great, and it may be a bit pricey, but the food is organic and the fish and the meat are from sustainable farms. It's not your typical taqueria, there is a a gourmet twist to the menu, so keep that in mind before coming here. With that being said, if you know that it's a bit more expensive and a little different going in, I think it's really great.
author: Toni R.

description: we had a pollo quesadilla and a fish taco.  Not bad, it does seem like they are still finding their way.  I actually liked the unconventional quesadilla preparation.  Price point could come down a bit.
author: sandy s.

description: We had the carne asada quesadilla and the caesar avocado salad.  The salad and the dressing were very tasty and plentiful.  The burrito was sizable and very fresh tasting.  I would like to come back and try some other items.
author: Brian L.

description: It's worth the price, because of the portion size.  I'm not a huge fan of $4+ tacos, but it was about a pound or so.  Quantity is never things when it comes to Mexican.  The rice was ok, the guacamole was pretty damn good though.  Throw it the incredibly fresh and flavorful hotsauce, and the fact I live kitty corner, and you have a great stop for quick Mexican fare in pac heights.
author: Kevin L.

description: There is mostly bar sitting. I ordered a quesadilla and it was definitely the most beautiful quesadilla I had, but the taste was just ok. Nice Ambience for a quick eat.
author: Tara R.

description:
taco bar is such a vast improvement over la salsa.  ingredients are fresh and delicious but nothing extraordinary.  i think the prices are fair  for the amount and quality of the food.

reading the previous reviews, i think part of the problem here is that san franciscans are spoiled.  we have so many wonderful food choices here that it's easy to dismiss a restaurant as bad when really it is decent or in fact good.  

adding some different spices/heat or ingredients beyond the basic mexican food ingredients to the menu would go a long way.  

will i go back again?  definitely.
author: Susan B.

description: taco bar is just the worst place that u can eat. The food does not have flavor, it's very expensive.  I  will never go back to this place again. i order a burrito and the meat was bland. I mean it.  They charge for extras. Chips and salsa it's another order.  I will reccomend you if you want a good burrito just walk to mission St. and for those who says the food its good. Please do not lie (fFOOD DOES NOT HAVE FLAVOR AT ALL . You do not want to waste your money in that place.
author: Ernesto L.

description: this place has gotten  a lot better but, still the fish tacos and burritos are too wet... making the shell and skin too soggy... they just opened and I can tell they are working very hard to get it right...  great aqua frescas...
author: William W.

description: Taco Bar needs to hit the reset button...  great concept, very promising, but its a disappointment.  After watching the remodel of the old "La Salsa", I saw the signage go up, read the "coming soon" news, and got excited that we would soon have a great new gourmet taco shop in the neighborhood.  The setting is nice, but the food is very bland, and the service is unacceptably slow.  I had the grilled fish tacos and the chips w/ gauc...  nice (proper) white corn tortillas, but the taco was 20% fish and 80% lettuce explosion!  What's w/ the massive lettuce mounds?  I felt like I was eating a salad, not a taco!  The chips were homemade, probably good when fresh, but mine were clearly old, stale, and a bit soggy...  c'mon, guys.  The gauc was so-so, a bit lifeless.  And where's the selection of salsa?  Good salsa can make just about anything taste good (even your boring fish tacos), and I was disappointed by the lack of offerings.  I realize that they haven't been open that long, and I am hopeful that they can get things right.  I really would love to see this concept work here.  Trying to be sincere...  please rethink things a bit, have a grand re-opening and let's see what you can really do!
author: B M.

description: was excited about the opening of a fresh, organic mexican cafe in the neighborhood.  stopped by on a sunday, craving a hard shell taco, but after eying the menu i found out they were $5/each-- and only soft shell. went with the veggie burrito.  rice, pinto beans, avocado, veggies- lacked any spice/flavor.   most disappointing part of the meal were the salsas- completely bland with no heat!  if the food isn't going to be well seasoned, they at least need to work on creating some flavorful salsas.
author: anjali s.
